title: Partner Enablement Manager
description:
**Job Title: Partner Enablement Manager**

**Location: Holmdel, NJ (In Office)**

Job Overview:

Exciting opportunity for the right person to build out a new enablement offering for our partners and customers. The Partner Enablement Manager will be responsible for developing and executing enablement programs that support our partners in effectively selling and delivering our Cyber Security products and services. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of developing and executing successful enablement programs, as well as experience working with partner ecosystems.

**Responsibilities:**

- Develop and execute enablement programs for partners, including training, certification, and sales enablement

- Own and maintain the Partner Relationship Management (PRM) system to ensure its functionality, efficiency, and alignment with business objectives

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify partner enablement needs and opportunities, and create and prioritize enablement initiatives accordingly

- Work closely with our sales and marketing teams to ensure that partner enablement programs are aligned with our go-to-market strategy and messaging

- Develop and deliver presentations and training sessions to partners, create and manage partner-facing content

- Measure the effectiveness of partner enablement programs and report on progress and success metrics to key stakeholders

- Continuously monitor and assess the effectiveness of our partner enablement programs and recommend improvements and enhancements as needed

**Requirements:**

- Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, or a related field

- Experience with enterprise technology, cyber security preferred

- 5+ years of experience in partner enablement or a related field, with a proven track record of success

- Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to present to audiences of all sizes and levels of seniority

- Strong project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously

- Experience working with partner ecosystems and knowledge of partner business models and strategies

- Knowledge of Salesforce as well as training and development software is required

- Proven ability to build and maintain strong relationships with partners and internal stakeholders

- Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment, and to thrive in a dynamic and changing organization

If this sounds like the right opportunity for you, please email Marketingresumes@indexengines.com your resume and a cover letter explaining why you would be a great fit for this role. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Restaurant Server
description:

Our contemporary farm-to-table restaurant features New England-inspired American cuisine, promoting the best of local produce and purveyors through seasonally inspired menus. If you are looking for a dynamic and fun environment to work, we are looking for you!

This is a great opportunity to join a dynamic hospitality team. **Artisan Southport** is part of **Greenwich Hospitality Group**, providing tremendous opportunity for personal growth and career development, right here in Connecticut. Join a team and culture that embodies the best of hospitality!

title: Associate Director of Nursing Level II - (MCH)
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals:**

**NYC Health + Hospitals/Community Care** reaches outside the walls of our hospitals and brings health care to patients where they live. With more than 600 dedicated employees, Community Care provides services including home care, community care coordination, and community-based care management to individuals managing chronic health conditions residing in Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens and The Bronx.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

**Job Description:**

***PURPOSE OF POSITION***

The Associate Director of Nursing (MCH) - Service Delivery will be responsible for providing oversight to a clinical team in the coordination and rendering of care delivery in the Certified Home Health Agency. This team will include Registered Nurses but may extend to other members of the interdisciplinary care team. The Associate Director of Nursing - Service Delivery is a part of the leadership team that will focus on ensuring the assigned clinicians strive to achieve the quality patient care outcomes that are steeped in evidence-based care and practices. In addition, the Associate Director of Nursing - Service Delivery will engage in efficient advisement, coaching and mentoring strategies to the members of the care team in order to meet clinical and professional goals. The Associate Director of Nursing- Service Delivery will stay abreast of industry trends-and regulatory guidelines that govern the home health care team and clinical practice.

**Duties & Responsibilities**

***SUMMARY OF DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:***

1. Directs, coordinates, and evaluates the delivery of Home Health services.

2. Monitors nursing staff assignments, caseloads, service utilization and team productivity.

3. Provides direct supervision to field staff, including on-site supervisory visits.

4. Ensures all documentation is timely and accurate, including Oasis, plans of care and daily visit documentation.

5. Participates and provide training and continuing education as necessary.

6. Participates in nursing orientation where indicated.

7. Evaluates and ensures competency requirements including semi-annual to annual field evaluations are met for all clinical staff.

8. Performs field visits for the purpose of evaluating community health nurses and /or other disciplines participating in family conferences and may be asked to perform nursing visits in times of increased demands or scheduling issues.

9. Identifies appropriate staffing patterns and needs of assigned staff based on productivity and team census.

10. Provides updates on census, staffing, team productivity and other reports as requested.

11. Responsible for performance evaluations and disciplinary action of all assigned staff.

12. Coordinates appropriate communication and documentation between patients, agency, medical professionals, and referral source.

13. Evaluates and suggest revisions to clinical documentation system.

14. Evaluates nursing documentation.

15. Performs case conferences and case load reviews for assigned staff as but minimally every two weeks.

16. Assists with assigned performance improvement data collection.

17. Implements performance improvement (PI) and Quality Assurance Performance Improvement (QAPI) plan as directed.

18. Ensures compliance with state and federal home health regulations as well as NYC H+H Home Care Policies and Procedures.

19. Participates in bimonthly to monthly QI meetings/Quality Committee and clinical record review when needed.

20. Participates in state or regulatory body surveys as needed.

21. Provides direct field supervision to staff as well as in the office staff in charge of care management and coordination.

22. Demonstrates sound judgment by taking appropriate actions regarding suspected violation of corporate compliance regulations.

23. Reports all suspected compliance issues to AED/DON, Compliance Officer or Compliance Hot line.

24. Leads and participates in case conferences, utilization review and utilization management of admitted cases.

25. Conducts case load reviews and chart audits on a weekly to bi-weekly basis for all clinicians assigned to their team and develops interventions to correct identified issues.

26. Ensures care delivery is rendered using the nursing process and based on DOH/CMS and billing guidelines.

27. Monitors key metrics on the clinical the clinical and operational dashboard in EMR and performs data collection activities and related data analysis of the home care program.

28. Follows through on complaints and grievances as per agency policy and conducts chart reviews as needed to ensure issues are addressed timely and thoroughly.

29. Continuously analyzes work processes and makes suggestion for improvement.

30. Assigns staff to Interdisciplinary Team as needed to review care delivery and promote interdisciplinary management of patients admitted to the home care department.

31. Works with other members of the Interdisciplinary Team and other Directors/Assistant Directors (Social Work and Rehabilitation) to develop appropriate interventions in order to achieve clinical and functionals goals.

32. Liaises with Schedulers, Assistant Director Nursing (TCNs) to coordinate patient referrals, patient care and patient assignments and assists in determining the patient's eligibity for Home Care.

33. Assures the formulation, implementation and updating of an individualized care plan for each patient admitted to the CHHA.

34. Provides ongoing assessment of admitted patients to ensure patient safety while on the home care program.

35. Provides coverage for weekend Assistant Director Nursing (ADN) as needed and when requested.

36. Performs other duties as assigned.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

***Qualification Requirements:***

1. Licensed and currently registered to practice as a Professional Nurse in New York State, plus (2) or (3) below.

2. A master’s degree in nursing administration, Education or an equivalent field and a minimum of six years of satisfactory nursing experience, of which four years shall have been in a supervisory, teaching or administrative capacity; or,

3. A Baccalaureate Degree in Nursing and seven years of satisfactory nursing experience, five years of which shall have been in a supervisory or teaching capacity; or,

4. A satisfactory equivalent combination of education and experience. However, all candidates must be licensed and currently registered to practice as a Professional Nurse in New York State.

***YEARS OF EXPERIENCE:***

Minimum of two (2) years' experience in a Certified Home Health Agency, Minimum of 2 years of Public/Community Health and 2 years in NICU, Mother/Baby Unit. Previous experience in PI, knowledge of PI applications, tools and techniques and knowledge of the development, coordination and facilitation of PI programs

1.At least One to two years' experience in a CHHA in a leadership role.

2. Demonstrated knowledge of the Home Health Conditions of Participation, DOH/CMS and Joint Commission Regulations.

3. One (1) to two (2) years' experience in acute care servicing MCH patients. AND 1. One (1) to two (2) years' experience as a CHHA nurse working with the MCH population AND 2. One (1) to two (2) years demonstrated experience in the role of Health Care Administrator in a Home Health Care Agency.

4. Demonstrate knowledge regarding Federal, State and local regulations and JACHO standards for Home Care. Excellent Verbal, written, organizational skills, and knowledge of Newborn, Antepartum, Postpartum, NICU and care across the spectrum from Newborn to age 17 years of age.

**Additional Qualifications**

***EQUIPMENT/MACHINES OPERATED:***

Smart phone - Laptop Computer - Desktop Computer - Multifunction Copier

***COMPUTER PROGRAMS/SOFTWARE OPERATED:***

Epic H20 Hyperspace - Epic H2O Remote Client - Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, One Note)

**NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:**

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $137,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* Day shift

Work Location: In person

title: Infant/Toddler Teacher
description:
**Position: Head Teacher – Infant/Toddler**

**Job Overview:**

We are looking for a dedicated and experienced Infant/Toddler Teacher to lead and collaborate with fellow educators in fostering the well-being, educational development, and supervision of children in our classroom. The ideal candidate will be committed to creating a nurturing environment that promotes the physical, social, emotional, and cognitive growth of infants and toddlers.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Lead and Inspire:** As the Head Teacher for Infants and Toddlers, you will be responsible for designing and maintaining an engaging and safe learning environment that supports the holistic development of young children.
* **Foster Growth:** Develop and implement age-appropriate activities and experiences that encourage the physical, social, emotional, and cognitive growth of each child.
* **Parent Partnership:** Build and maintain strong, positive relationships with parents to support their children’s growth and development, ensuring open communication and collaboration.
* **Team Collaboration:** Work closely with peers and management to achieve successful outcomes in infant and toddler education, contributing to a supportive and effective team dynamic.
* **Maintain Professionalism:** Demonstrate exceptional communication skills, using tact and diplomacy in all interactions with children, parents, and staff. Uphold the highest standards of professionalism at all times.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience in infant/toddler education and a strong background in child development.
* Ability to lead and work collaboratively with a team.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Commitment to creating a positive and enriching environment for children.

If you are passionate about early childhood education and have the skills and experience to lead our infant/toddler program, we encourage you to apply.

**Additional Requirements**

* CDA (Required)
* NYS Teaching Assistance or Associate Degree in Early Childhood Education (Preferred)
* Experience in childcare setting
* Must be able to lift at least 50 pounds

Obtain CPR/First Aid, Child Abuse and Preventing Infectious Diseases within the first six months of employment

title: Grade 4 Classroom Teacher
description:
Job Description: Grade 4 Teacher

Our Lady of Lourdes School, an elementary school serving students in North Manhattan and District 6 since 1912, offers a rigorous academic curriculum and foundation in faith to foster well-rounded individuals. We offer an exceptional enrichment program: individualized instruction in the arts, dance, language, music, faith and religion, science/STEM, and athletics. Fostering cultural appreciation prepares our students to lead successful lives in high school and beyond. We embrace students of varied abilities with diverse ethnic, linguistic, and religious backgrounds.

**Description: Catholic School Grade 4 Teacher; Start Date: 9/1/24 End Date: 8/31/25**

* Fulfills the mission of the Catholic Church by planning, guiding and evaluating the learning process of the students.
* Will be expected to provide the appropriate learning atmosphere and activities designed to maximize student competencies and skills for spiritual, intellectual, emotional, physical and social and growth toward a successful future.
* Prepares ELA, Math, Religion, Science, and Social Studies lessons for Grade 4.
* Implements the curricula by responsibly using the Archdiocesan Guidelines for Catechesis and Academics and the NYS Next Generation Learning Standards.
* Enthusiastically facilitates learning by initiating, directing, and evaluating the learning process.
* Encourages self-initiated learning and self-direction in students.
* Promotes diverse approaches to problem solving
* Demonstrates use of technology to enhance student performance.

The essential functions of teaching include, but are not limited to preparation of all daily lessons, daily instruction of all assigned classes of students; classroom management and discipline of all assigned classes of students; diagnosis and evaluation of students’ mastery of learning or lack thereof; preparation of remedial lessons where necessary; reporting student progress to parents as needed and during school-scheduled conferences; meeting with parents upon their request; attendance and participation at meetings pertaining to the professional planning and evaluation of the total school program.

**Prospective teacher candidates are required to have:**

· A minimum of a BACHELOR'S DEGREE in Education or a related subject area from an accredited college or university.

· Teaching experience

A successfully cleared background check.

**Preference is given to:**

· Candidates with New York State Certification in Education

· Candidates with a Master's Degree in Education or a related field of study

Teaching experience

title: Community Health Nurse -Maternal Child Health (MCH)/Brooklyn
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals:**

**NYC Health + Hospitals/Community Care** reaches outside the walls of our hospitals and brings health care to patients where they live. With more than 600 dedicated employees, Community Care provides services including home care, community care coordination, and community-based care management to individuals managing chronic health conditions residing in Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens and The Bronx.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

**Job Description:**

***PURPOSE OF POSITION***

Under the direction of the supervising Assistant Director of Nursing in Community Care, assesses, plans, implements, and evaluates the patient’s plan of care. Provides direct skilled nursing care and observes and instructs the patient in their place of residence. May coordinate services of other caregivers.

Duties & Responsibilities

***SUMMARY OF DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES***

1. Provides individualized skilled Nursing care to the patients requiring part-time intermittent professional nursing service through the use of the nursing process.

2. Provides assessment of patient and develops a plan of treatment and care with ongoing evaluation of patient/family needs for other services.

3. Provides professional nursing services as outlined in the patient's plan of treatment and authorized by patient's physician, and provides emergency treatment as needed.

4. Records physical, social, psychosocial and environmental needs of the patient. Provide ongoing monitoring of the patient in the home care setting and escalates any clinical changes to the physician or non-physician provider as needed.

5. Utilizes input from patient, caregiver, MD and peers to devise a Nursing Care Plan which is feasible within

6. Competent to complete thorough and accurate nursing assessments for the Maternal Child Health (MCH) patients

7. Evaluates patient's response to plan of care as necessary, consistent with physician's orders.

8. Reviews and revises plan of care as necessary, consistent with physician's orders.

9. Plans activities necessary for effectuating the timely discharge/transfer of patient and notifies all appropriate parties including patient's physician.

10. Authorize & coordinate all services including nursing, rehab, respiratory therapy, nutritional services, equipment, professional and non-professional staffing and support services.

11. Collaborates with Assistant Director of Nursing (ADN) and other disciplines regarding the MCH and/or pediatric patient’s progress and discharge plans.

12. Demonstrates a professional attitude and ethical conduct in compliance with departmental standards.

13. Involves the patient and caregiver actively in goal setting.

14. Establishes and maintains a cooperative, effective working relationship with the staff, physicians, Case Managers and other hospital personnel, outside vendors, agencies and the community at large, including mandating reporting to Administration for Children’s Services (ACS) if deemed necessary.

15. Attends weekly to bimonthly team meetings and participates in case conferences and case load reviews on a weekly to biweekly basis.

16. Completes Physician’s Orders in a timely manner.

17. Completes admission paperwork, including Physician and Nursing Plans of Care (POCs) within 48 hours of visit encounter.

18. Reviews clinical records to ensure compliance with departmental and regulatory standard the physical, financial and emotional resources of the patient/caregiver and the Department of Health.

19. Obtains written orders for all verbal orders returned.

20. Writes clean and concise progress notes that reflect the implementation of the plan of care and the patient’s response to that plan of care.

21. Maintain up-to-date patient files with complete records including care plans and re-certifications, reports of all services rendered, progress notes and discharge summaries.

22. Competent in knowledge of patient teaching plans and interventions for the MCH and/or pediatric patients.

23. Competent in knowledge of safe administration and teaching medications.

24. Demonstrates safety and accuracy in performing treatments and procedures according to the Home Care Department standards of care/practice.

25. Demonstrate competence in skilled nursing interventions.

26. Competent in knowledge of documentation requirements for Home Care.

27. Participates in case conferences and/or Interdisciplinary Team conferences as needed and as designated by the Clinical Manager.

28. Works with other members of the Interdisciplinary Team to develop appropriate interventions in order to achieve clinical and functional goals.

29. Participates in the agency’s Quality Assurance Performance Improvement/PIP as assigned.

30. Supervises and monitors the care given by home health aides and ensures proper documentation.

31. Participates in an interdisciplinary health care team in determining and implementing a comprehensive plan of care.

32. Participates in the coordination of other professional and para-professional services in the home and provides supervision as needed.

33. Provides mother/pediatric and/or caregiver with teaching and involves them in assessment activities.

34. Maintains current, complete, and appropriate documentation in the patient care record. May be required to use computer systems in carrying out these functions.

35. Duties include but may not be limited to wound care, including NPWT/VAC, removal of Prevena Vac, Provide Infant, heel-stick for infants with Hyperbilirubinemia, based on MD orders. Assessment for Postpartum Depression, Assessing for signs and symptoms and appropriate follow up for the Pre- eclampsia patient.

36. Provides teaching on disease and medication management.

37. Obtains photographs for consultation by wound specialists.

38. Ability to apply evidence-based practices to the home care setting.

39. Ability to walk up and down stairs while carrying infant scale and nursing bag.

40. And other duties as ordered/prescribed.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

***QUALIFICATIONS FOR THE JOB: CERTIFICATION(S)/LICENSE(S):***

1. A valid New York State license and current registration to practice as a Registered Professional Nurse in New York State; and

2. Holds, or obtains through facility orientation, a valid and current certification in Basic Life Support (BLS) through the American Heart Association (AHA); and

3. One (1) year of experience as a registered nurse; and

4. Ability to travel regularly to patient/client assignments across New York City via public transportation and/or private vehicle; and

5. Demonstrated commitment to continued professional development.

***YEARS OF EXPERIENCE:***

Minimum two (2) year of full-time nursing experience; and at least one (1) year of experience in a hospital setting; and at least one (1) year of experience working in a Labor- Delivery, Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU), or postpartum care setting.

***KNOWLEDGEABLE IN:***

Demonstrated knowledge regarding Federal, State and local regulations and JCAHO standards for Home Care. Excellent verbal, written, organizational and analytical skills. Demonstrated competence as a registered nurse in patient assessments and critical thinking skills.

**Additional Qualifications**

***EQUIPMENT/MACHINES OPERATED:***

Smart phone - Laptop Computer - Desktop Computer - Multifunction Copier - Nursing bag with baby scale

***COMPUTER PROGRAMS/SOFTWARE OPERATED:***

EPIC H2O Hyperspace, EPIC H2O Remote Client, Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, OneNote)

title: Assistant Custodian
description:
Nederlander Producing Company of America is seeking enthusiastic Assistant Custodians to join our theatre operations staff. Direct experience with theatrical performance is not required.

  



This role is a key member of our team in keeping our historic and modern buildings in top physical condition. Job duties include maintaining cleanliness in lobbies, restrooms, backstage, dressing rooms, and sidewalk in front of theatre, as well as vacuuming and mopping, removal of trash, shining brass, and additional maintenance tasks as necessary from the assigned theatre. This position may also interact with the public during performances; to that end, we are looking for team members who are friendly, helpful, and take initiative to ensure that the theatre is looking as beautiful as possible for our guests. This position will require working a regular schedule in one of our theatres to ensure that the theatre is properly staffed and cleaned. This position reports to the Head Custodian.

  



You will be joining a high-energy, detail-focused team that plays a central role in keeping our Broadway theatres running smoothly. You will work inside a collaborative, respectful, and driven company to provide a magical Broadway theatre experience to all patrons and production personnel. This customer-service forward approach creates the magical Broadway theatre experience that instills lifelong memories and strengthens our Broadway fan base.

  


**ABOUT NEDERLANDER PRODUCING COMPANY OF AMERICA**



The Nederlander Organization and Nederlander Producing Company of America are committed to a workplace where everyone is free from bias, prejudice, discrimination, and harassment. The organization strives to ensure a welcoming work environment where everyone belongs and is valued, encouraged, and respected for their unique contributions. We are focused on building a culture that acknowledges and values Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion. As such, we are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our organization.


**JOB REQUIREMENTS**


* Enthusiastic and excellent interpersonal skills
* Proactive and effective time management
* Ability to lift up to 20 to 50 lbs.
* Ability to walk up and down flights of stairs and stand for the duration of a shift.
* Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
* Ability to follow health and safety standards and protocols.
* Must be able to work well with a team and provide exceptional customer service skills by treating all patrons and coworkers with respect.
* Previous experience in a similar role is preferred.
* This is a union affiliated position. Must be or become a member of Local 32BJ.


**JOB HOURS**



Majority of work hours will occur in the morning but must be available to return for performances and/or post-performance cleaning 1-3 times per week. Must be available to work a flexible schedule of 6 days a week, including weekends and holidays.


**NEDERLANDER PRODUCING COMPANY OF AMERICA OFFERS**



Local 32BJ Union Benefits including Health and Pension.



Base Pay: $23.00 per hour

description:
We’re looking for a Part- Time TikTok content creator to join our team. We're looking for someone local to the NYC area to create video and image content for a female owned fine jewelry & bridal brand.

We’re looking for a social media enthusiast who has grown an account (your own counts!) and/or is passionate about creating content and building a community for our social media accounts.

We’re looking for someone who can commit to 20-25 hours a week to the brand. This is a part time, hybrid position (must be able to come into the office 1x a week to shoot content). College students encouraged to apply! Minimum 3 month commitment

As our chief content creator, we will lean on you to manage creating weekly video content, implementing trending social media strategies to help increase views, engagement, driving traffic to our website and managing an editorial calendar to maintain the brand's voice. The ideal candidate has experience in content creation, social media, and media planning. A strong social media presence is a plus but not necessary. If you are a creative and strategic thinker, apply now to bring your unique vision to our brand.

**Description of work (but not limited too)**

Responsible for executing TikTok social content, briefed in by social strategy and created in collaboration with founder.

Able to embody and portray our brand personality and voice in social content and in the comments section.

Create, shoot and edit TikTok content that aligns with marketing strategies, product launches and key campaigns

Brainstorm inventive content ideas and topics that drive engagement, leverage new formats

Engage with comments and community, as well as commenting on other relevant content to the brand in the platform

Identify trends on the rise and quickly create content to grow engagement and community size within the platform, staying nimble and open to experimenting with new creative concepts

Ability to research, script and shoot engaging content while maintaining brand authenticity

Build and cultivate AARYAH's TikTok community

Contribute to other social media projects where needed

Source user generated content and identify opportunities for collaborations

Establish a data-driven approach to inform and build overall social strategy to increase awareness and engagement, gaining insights into our target audience and their social media habits.

work with our team to repurpose video content for website and other outlets.

Preferred credentials:

- experience creating TikTok content (extra points if you have a following/community/ viral videos)

- Is interested and follows luxury goods, fashion, and jewelry accounts

- Tech savvy, honest, responsible, and reliable

- Strong organization skills ( you love calendars!)

- A high-energy self-starter with the motivation to work hard and manage projects to completion

title: Warehouse Operations Manager
description:
**About us**

Hummel Croton, Inc. is a small business in South Plainfield, NJ.

Specializing in the manufacture and distribution of specialty inorganic and organic chemicals. We serve industries including aerospace, automotive, electronics, flame retardants, metal processing, ordnance, pharmaceuticals, pollution controls, pyrotechnics, and textiles.

Our history dates back to 1913. Originally focused on the fireworks industry, we adapted during World War II to support ordnance manufacturers.

**About the position**

We are looking for a highly organized and experienced Warehouse Manager to lead our warehouse operations. This hands-on leadership role involves managing inventory, coordinating shipments, and ensuring accurate order fulfillment.

The Warehouse Manager will work closely with the Shipping and Receiving Department and coordinate operations with the Chemical Manufacturing Supervisor. Strong communication and problem-solving skills are essential.

title: Project Officer II - NYCSCA Experienced
description:
**Who We Are**  
Enovate is an Engineering firm that specializes in Construction Management, Transportation Engineering and Monitoring services. Since its inception a few years ago, Enovate was able to position its brand as a leading WBE/DBE engineering/CM firm. We have teamed with and supported well-known Engineering and CM firms and worked on flagship projects in both the public and private sectors.

Our diverse team consists of Professional Engineers, Construction Managers, Engineers and Technicians from varied backgrounds – design, project management and construction. This is an opportunity to work with Enovate as we expand to meet the demand of this wide range of services and excel in a traditional industry that is ever changing with the adoption of technology.

***We are proud to be certified as a Great Place to Work 2023-2024, a Best Place to Work, 2021 as voted by NJBIZ, recipient of the Diversity & Inclusion Award from Anchin, a Zweig Top New Venture for 2021, among other accolades.***

Learn more at www.enovateengineering.com

**Position Summary**  
We are seeking a **Project Officer II** with 5+ years of experience to oversee various NYC school construction projects. The Project Officer II will work closely with the Project Team in both office and field environments to ensure the successful development and construction of high-quality school projects. The ideal candidate should be not only an excellent project manager but also an effective communicator and team player.

**We’re seeking someone with a strong desire to play a versatile role within a fast-growing company.**

**Key Responsibilities**

* Oversee the administration and coordination of complex school construction projects.
* Ensure quality and high standards of performance and compliance in both design and construction by all consultants, vendors, etc.
* Make decisions and take timely actions to expedite the completion of the school construction process.
* Correct design and construction errors early in the process.
* Make decisions on project phasing and scheduling.
* Prepare and monitor schedules for planning, design, and construction to ensure timely project completion within approved cost limitations.
* Interface with contractors, construction managers, local school personnel, and Senior Project Officers on project issues.
* Participate in the development and issuance of project procedures and policies.
* Provide guidance and advice to lower-level Project Officers.
* Resolve issues and problems raised in field reports made by architects and construction management staff.
* Work with the architect/engineer of record regarding change orders, contract documents, shop drawing submittals/approvals, and other technical matters.
* Issue field memoranda or directives to contractors to enforce contract compliance.
* Advise senior management regarding the necessity for the assessment of liquidated damages and other contractual enforcement mechanisms.
* Review contractors' claims or disputed work and advise senior management on appropriate action.
* Compile contract and project documentation necessary for adjudicating or denying such claims.
* Visit various job sites as required in the performance of duties.

**Desired Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Construction Management, or a related field preferred.
* 5 or more years of progressively responsible work as a technical specialist in construction and design-related fields.
* Valid driver's license in New York State.
* Experience managing all phases of construction work on a scale and scope similar to the SCA.
* Excellent teamwork, communication, and people skills.
* Strong time management and organizational skills.
* Knowledge of construction codes, practices, QA/QC policies, performance standards, and specifications.
* Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, and project management software.

Even if you don't feel that you meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply. We're eager to meet people that believe in Enovate's mission and can contribute to our team in a variety of ways - not just candidates who check all the boxes. We want people to feel comfortable expressing their true selves and to come, stay, and do their best work here.

**Pay/Benefits**

Enovate has great benefits. We provide medical, dental and vision on the first day of your employment. Life insurance, 401(k) matching plan, volunteer time off, wellness programs and many other optional programs are offered as well.

The listed salary range represents our good faith estimate for this position and represents the range for new hire salaries across all U.S locations. Please note that the salary information is a general guideline only. Enovate considers factors such as (but not limited to) scope and responsibilities of the position, candidate’s education & work experience, training & certifications, and key skills as well as market and business considerations at the time of the offer.

Enovate is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As a leader in diversity, equity and inclusion, we are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. We provide equal opportunities to applicants and teammates regardless of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Overtime

Experience:

* overseeing NYC school construction projects: 5 years (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* driver's license in NY State (Preferred)

title: Assistant Director
description:
**THE ORGANIZATION**

Jacob A. Riis Neighborhood Settlement (Riis Settlement), a community-based non-profit organization offering comprehensive services to the youth, adults, older adults, immigrants and families of Western Queens, is dedicated to civic engagement and organizing as integral to our mission “to build and strengthen underserved communities and act as a catalyst for change.” For more information about Jacob A. Riis Neighborhood Settlement, please view our website at www.riissettlement.org

**JOB DESCRIPTION**

We are looking for an Assistant Director who will be responsible for the overall planning and operation of the Program in accordance with the Jacob A. Neighborhood Settlement mission, goals, and policies. Provide leadership, direction, training, and support to on-site staff and volunteers in the safe and structured operation of the center. Must have experience in DYCD/ Advantage programs.

**JOB RESPONSIBILITIES**

**Major Duties and Responsibilities**

* Under the management of the Program Director, establish goals and objectives for the program and effectively oversee all programs and operations.
* Ensure compliance with Riis Settlement Agency policies. Prepare and organize all monthly documents program reports on a scheduled basis.
* Work with Agency personnel to ensure that organizational objectives are accomplished. To ensure the smooth day-to-day running, coordination and supervision of all program-related staff and services in accordance with all program goals, targets, and performance outcomes and all Riis Settlement, and program policies, procedures, and protocols
* Understand all aspects of contract requirements and communicate this understanding to staff.
* Communicate with peers in other Jacob A. Riis Neighborhood and school staff.
* Work with staff to set realistic weekly and monthly performance targets in accordance with contract requirements.
* Supervise, train and Coach Group Leaders, Specialists engaging with participants.
* Assist the Program Director in providing oversight for all aspects of the program in his/her absence.
* Assist in the analysis of program and demographic client data to make programmatic improvements.
* Identify and develop curricula suitable for after-school and summer programs. Curricula should be thematic and provide youth with sequential, common core learning standards-aligned learning experiences.
* Organize onsite and offsite training opportunities for the professional development of staff.
* Plan and organize program activities to maximize program contract's goals and performance targets as outlined in the Work Scope.
* Plan, coordinate and facilitate social/peer support and program events.
* Provide assistance and follow-up in regards to critical incidents with participants.
* Liaison with subcontractors to ensure appropriate service delivery and quality.
* When the Director is not present, ensure staff utilization of electronic databases and conduct oversight to ensure data integrity.
* Conduct and document one-on-one supervision of direct reporting staff to assess and improve work performance (i.e. identify training needs, professional development, etc.).
* Prepare performance appraisals for direct reporting staff: Group Leaders and Specialists.
* Attend staff/funder/outside agency meetings as requested.

**Additional Responsibilities**

* Convene meetings with staff, volunteers/interns, program members, parents, and community residents as needed to assist in program delivery, communicate established policies, and promote a positive environment.
* Develop collaborative relationships with other community-based organizations to enhance program offerings.
* Organize and/or participate in external special events to promote the Agency's mission and image, cultivate relationships, and generate broad support.
* Complete the minimum training hours as set forth in the New York State School-Age Child Care (SACC) Regulations.

**STATEMENT OF SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:** 

***Education and Experience:*** 

* Credits towards Bachelor's degree from an accredited college in Child Development, Elementary Education, Physical Education- with at least 18 hours in Early Childhood Education Master's degree preferred
* DYCD/Advantage qualifications: meet or exceed all contract requirements including all data and work scope entries
* School-Age Child Care (SACC) license is a plus/ and or SAAC Credential Qualification is a plus.
* A minimum of three years of demonstrated successful experience in a supervisory position providing services to youth that includes program management and staff supervision, with at least two years in a leadership capacity.
* Demonstrated skills and competency in youth development program planning and administration, and the ability to supervise multiple staff.
* Leadership skills in conflict intervention, negotiation, decision-making, and delegation.
* Strong communication skills, both oral and written. Ability to speak effectively and persuasively to staff, members, parents, groups and community residents.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office applications and Google apps.

**Benefits:**

* Generous Paid Time Off package of 12 holidays, 12 sick days, 10 days of vacation, and 6 personal days.
* Retirement plan with 50% employer match up to 6% of total salary
* Student Loan Assistance and Education Assistance
* Health, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance
* EAP Services

Jacob A. Riis Neighborhood Settlement is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth and pregnancy-related conditions), gender identity or expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and ordinances.

Pay: $45,000.00 per year

title: Family Law Firm Paralegal
company: Law Office of Edward Fradkin, LLC
description:
Provide legal support to the attorney within a busy family law practice including divorce, custody, support, and domestic violence matters. Provide administrative and secretarial support as needed. Responsibilities include the following:

* Draft pleadings, proposed orders, agreements and submissions for mediation/ESP. Draft complex motions and compile exhibits for same; incorporate edits upon attorney and client review and prepare for filing.
* Document retrieval including the preparation of subpoenas and other information requests. Review of documents for organization, summation and analysis purposes and preparing memo/charts of same.
* Draft Case Information Statements utilizing EasySoft.
* Manage the QDRO process.
* Establish a relationship with clients to facilitate communications and to assist with any questions regarding their case status and/or their understanding of the legal process.
* Maintain a working knowledge and tracking system of the status of cases to proactively assist the attorney, ensuring that due dates are met and that the attorney is prepared for upcoming events.
* Assist the attorney in preparation for trial/arbitration; organize exhibits and binders.
* Prepare submissions for Appellate Court in accordance with the Court's standards and practices.
* Maintain a relationship with court staff and other firms to ensure amiable and cooperative communications.

title: Medical Assistant - Dermatology
description:
Walk-in Dermatology is a rapidly expanding healthcare company combining traditional dermatology with the convenience of urgent care. This is a fantastic opportunity to apply your skills in an environment where you’ll play a key role in the success of the company and where you’ll be rewarded for your contribution.

In addition to getting a generous compensation package, you’ll get a full suite of benefits including healthcare insurance, paid vacation, and 401K. This is your opportunity to work with an entrepreneurial team dedicated to having fun and improving dermatology care (Just check our Google reviews to see why patients LOVE us).

We are looking for experienced Medical Assistants to perform various office and clinical duties in our Greenvale and Plainview offices. We offer a positive, upbeat work environment where we all work together to provide exceptional patient care.

**Responsibilities:**

* Serve as a patient advocate during exam and treatment
* Direct patients to/from exam rooms to maintain timely flow of patients in the office
* Interview patients and record patient data into the electronic medical record system
* Conduct patient assessments and obtain medical information for referral to the provider or nurse
* Assist providers in obtaining consents prior to treatment or procedures
* Assist providers with documenting patient exams and procedures
* Assist providers with common dermatology procedures
* Prepare and stock exam rooms, ordering supplies as needed
* Assist in follow-up care for patients including obtaining patient records and making phone calls
* Assist in prescription fulfillment, including prior authorizations

**Required Education & Experience:**

* 2+ years experience in a dermatology practice setting is required
* High school degree or GED required
* Certified as a Medical Assistant by the Commission of Accreditation of Allied Health Education Programs or Accrediting Bureau of Health Education Schools
* Strong knowledge of medical terminology
* Hands-on experience with electronic medical records
* Knowledge of common safety hazards and precautions to establish a safe work environment
* Reliable, punctual, and detail-oriented

If you have relevant experience and are interested in joining a fun and dynamic team, we’d like to hear from you.

We offer flexible hours including evenings and weekends, as well as a full benefits package, including health, dental, vision, PTO, and 401K. Compensation will be commensurate with experience. Interested candidates should reply with a resume and cover letter.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 - $26.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid sick time
* Paid time off

* Vision insurance

title: Retail Sales Associate- Womens Shoes
description:
**Join Our Team and Be Part of Something Amazing!**

At Macys, we are dedicated to fostering a dynamic and inclusive work environment where every individual's uniqueness is celebrated. We believe that by empowering our team members, we can collectively drive innovation and success. If you are passionate about delivering exceptional customer service and creating memorable shopping experiences, we invite you to bring your talents to our Retail Sales Associate position.

**Job Overview:**

As a Retail Sales Associate, you will play a pivotal role in providing unparalleled customer service in our retail store. Your primary responsibilities will include engaging with customers, promoting sales, handling cash transactions, and maintaining a welcoming shopping environment. By utilizing your excellent communication skills and product knowledge, you will assist customers in finding the perfect items that suit their preferences and budget.

**Key Duties:**

- Engage with customers to understand their needs and offer personalized product recommendations  
- Process cash transactions accurately using a cash register  
- Maintain a tidy and organized store environment  
- Assist customers with inquiries and provide information about products  
- Participate in inventory management tasks such as restocking shelves and monitoring stock levels  
- Utilize point-of-sale systems efficiently to process sales transactions  
- Collaborate with team members to achieve sales targets and deliver exceptional customer service

**Requirements:**

- Prior experience in retail sales or customer service is preferred  
- Proficiency in basic math skills for handling cash transactions  
- Strong communication abilities to effectively interact with customers and colleagues  
- Knowledge of POS systems is an advantage  
- Familiarity with electronics sales is a plus

If you are enthusiastic about sales, enjoy working in a fast-paced environment, and possess excellent communication skills, we encourage you to apply for the Retail Sales Associate position at Macys. Join us in creating memorable shopping experiences for our valued customers!

Macys is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a diverse and inclusive workplace. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds to join our team dedicated to excellence in customer service.

**Apply now to embark on an exciting career journey with us!**

title: DSP (Direct Support Professional)
description:
**Job Description:**  
Assists individuals with intellectual/developmental disabilities to lead a independent life; assists with activities of daily living and encourages attitudes and behaviors that enhance community inclusion.

**Education and/or Experience:**  
High School Diploma or General Education Degree (GED); One year of experience working with people with developmental disabilities preferred.

**Essential Duties:**

* Responsibilities and Essential Duties including but not limited to the following as well as any other duties as assigned by supervisory staff.
* Implement and assist individuals with completion of goals and document efforts in the Daily Training Record and Progress Notes.
* Provide assistance in daily activities, which may include bathing, feeding, cooking, toileting.
* Ensure optimal physical/mental health by assisting individuals with scheduled medical/psychiatric appointments, monitoring medication supply and administering medication, following prescribed diets, and treatment/behavior plans.
* Utilize crisis intervention and personal control techniques as trained, to ensure safety to individual and others.
* Ensure a safe and healthy living environment through routine facility and vehicle inspections, disinfecting, cleaning, reporting of facility and vehicle deficiencies, encouraging clients to participate in household chores, and keeping routes of egress free from obstruction, including snow, furniture, etc.
* Provide safe transportation to and from work/day program services, scheduled appointments, and recreational activities or assist clients in scheduling public transportation.
* Monitor individual's daily activity through documentation in progress notes, T-Log, and verbal communication with supervisors and co-workers.
* Report all incidents, including allegations of abuse, neglect, exploitation, injury and other reportable incidents immediately upon discovery.
* Cooperate fully with investigative processes, and provide complete and accurate information. Keep all information discussed in investigations confidential.
* Attend all mandatory meetings and training as required.
* Monitor own time card to ensure correct recording of hours worked, and use of benefit time.
* Adhere to all Agency policies and procedures.
* Practice and implement all emergency procedures including, but not limited to: fire, disaster drills, and other crisis response procedures.
* Adhere to all confidentiality policies, practices, and laws.
* Communicates effectively and professionally with peers, leadership, guardians/family, and stakeholders in person, and via phone and email.
* Provide assistance to clients to communicate special funds requests, personal needs, and assist with the distribution of laundry funds when applicable.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $19.75 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Every weekend
* Holidays
* Monday to Friday
* Night shift
* Overtime

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Experience:

* DSP: 1 year (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

title: Investment Consultant - Millburn, NJ
description:
**Job Description:**
--------------------

**Investment Consultant**
-------------------------


You joined the financial services industry to make a difference in the lives of your clients. At Fidelity, we have a relentless commitment to our clients. Come join a firm that is a stable industry leader where we focus on the importance of communicating to connect and not just communicating to transact. We empower professional flexibility, growth, and support thus enabling long-term success for you and our clients.

**The Purpose of Your Role**
----------------------------


Working in our Investor Center, you will develop customized financial plans through a wide range of products and services using your sound judgment, keen knowledge of products, and Fidelity‘s planning tools. Instead of spending your time sourcing new customers, you will engage with existing clients and warm leads, which will allow your focus to remain where it matters most: providing investment solutions and growing relationships with a dedicated local advisor.

**The Expertise We’re Looking For**
-----------------------------------

* Effectively utilizing Fidelity’s guidance tools, you engage in financial planning discussions by presenting solutions and service offerings that best meet client needs
* Leveraging technology, you can prepare for and conduct efficient one-on-one appointments to make the best use of the client’s time, as well as plan for post-appointment follow-up
* Growing relationships through proactive outreach, you seek to understand clients’ goals and objectives and refer them to a wealth management partner based on needs and financial complexity
* Series 7 & 63 licensed; Series 65 or 66 and appropriate state registrations preferred, OR ability to acquire quickly upon hire
* Degree and/or other professional certifications such as a CFP are helpful; if you don’t already have a CFP or degree, our Tuition Reimbursement program can help you obtain one!

**The Skills You Bring**
------------------------

* You have a comprehensive understanding of various investment solutions, and can educate customers on the values and differences of each
* Your interpersonal skills and ability to grow relationships are exemplary; you take initiative and exceed expectations
* You have outstanding communication and consultative skills, and you thrive in a fast-paced work environment

**Our Investments in You**
--------------------------


Fidelity’s greatest advantage is our people, and we believe it is important to approach life holistically. We offer a competitive total rewards package, including a stable base salary, to recognize associate achievements. And our benefit programs are designed to help you and your family strike the right balance. We offer training in-branch, regionally, nationally, and virtually to help you with all aspects of your business. You will not fail due to a lack of training or onboarding!

**The Value You Deliver**
-------------------------


In this role you will work directly with clients to help them make investment decisions that are in their best interest. By effectively navigating Fidelity’s planning and guidance tools, presenting and implementing solutions that best meet the client’s needs, you will have a lasting impact on the client’s financial future.  

  

Please note this role requires in-person attendance in the assigned Branch location.

**Certifications:**
-------------------


Series 07 - FINRA, Series 66 - FINRA**Company Overview**


Fidelity Investments is a privately held company with a mission *to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients.* We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients’ money.


**Join Us**


At Fidelity, you’ll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples’ lives, including yours. You can take advantage of flexible benefits that support you through every stage of your career, empowering you to thrive at work and at home. Honored with a Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, we have been recognized by our employees as a top 10 Best Place to Work in 2024. And you don’t need a finance background to succeed at Fidelity—we offer a range of opportunities for learning so you can build the career you’ve always imagined.


Fidelity's working model blends the best of working offsite with maximizing time together in person to meet associate and business needs. Currently, most hybrid roles require associates to work onsite all business days of one assigned week per four-week period (beginning in September 2024, the requirement will be two full assigned weeks).


**At Fidelity, we value honesty, integrity, and the safety of our associates and customers within a heavily regulated industry**. Certain roles may require candidates to go through a preliminary credit check during the screening process. Candidates who are presented with a Fidelity offer will need to go through a background investigation, detailed in this document, and may be asked to provide additional documentation as requested. This investigation includes but is not limited to a criminal, civil litigations and regulatory review, employment, education, and credit review (role dependent). These investigations will account for 7 years or more of history, depending on the role. Where permitted by federal or state law, Fidelity will also conduct a pre-employment drug screen, which will review for the following substances: Amphetamines, THC (marijuana), cocaine, opiates, phencyclidine.


We invite you to **Find Your Fidelity** at fidelitycareers.com.


Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging.


Fidelity will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to participate in the application or interview process. To initiate a request for an accommodation, contact the HR Accommodation Team by sending an email to accommodations@fmr.com.
company_description: At Fidelity Investments, you’ll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples’ lives, including yours.

title: Assistant Studio Manager
description:
**Benefits:**  

* Flexible schedule
* Opportunity for advancement
* Training & development

  

**Be fit. Change lives. Have fun.**  

  

**A little quiz:** What do Batman and Robin, Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid, Hermoine Granger and Harry Potter, and Venus and Serena Williams have in common?  

  

**Answer**: Each member of the pair makes the other stronger.  

  

That’s how it is with an Orangetheory Studio Manager and Assistant Studio Manager (ASM). They’re a doublet, a duo, a dyad. And while the manager is ultimately in charge, without that able-bodied sidekick, the studio wouldn’t run nearly as smoothly.  

  

So if you’d like to be half of such a pair, to know the ropes as well as you know your members’ names, to step in when your manager steps out, to balance each other’s strengths, to set goals and surpass them...then Orangetheory just might be looking for you.  

  

**We Offer**
  

* We provide substantial paid training, certifications, and support to ensure your success
* Compensation includes competitive base pay and commission.
* Free Studio Membership with a required 2 OTF classes at the Forest Hills Location
* Product discounts
* Flexible schedule that works around educational or personal goals
* Fitness casual dress-code
* Passionate, collaborative work environment
* The opportunity to learn every aspect of the business to eventually other management opportunities

**Here’s more of what the position entails:**  

* Greeting everyone who enters the studio with enthusiasm, energy and knowledge
* Presenting the OTF concept to any interested consumers, also known as “intros” while working hand in hand with the coaches
* Giving studio tours
* Selling memberships to help the studio thrive
* Leading and developing fellow staff members while on shift
* Following up on prospective clients to book their first OTF classes
* Handling members’ concerns in a professional and objective manner with the goal of resolution
* Participating in marketing and outreach events
* Ensuring all areas of the studio are kept clean and organized
* Participating in 1 staff meeting per month for further development

  

Every day will be different, but you’ll be representing the Orangetheory brand as you share the science of this workout you want everyone to love as much as you do.  

Maybe you’ll use this post as a stepping stone in your management career, or perhaps this is where you want to be forever. But if you’ve been at even one Orangetheory class, you feel the warmth, the enthusiasm, the genuine sense of being where you need to be — feelings you’ll be hard-pressed to find anywhere but here.  

  

Specific job duties and selection requirements vary between Orangetheory studio locations and more details can be provided by the studio’s hiring manager if you are selected to move forward in the interview process.  

Acknowledgement \\*



I understand that I am applying for a position with an employer that is an independently owned and operated Orangetheory® Fitness franchisee, not the franchisor, OTF Franchisor, LLC or any of its affiliates (OTFF). With respect to any position with a franchisee, I understand and agree that any information I provide in this application will be submitted directly to the independent franchisee, who is solely responsible for all employment related matters in their studio. This means, among other things, that the independent franchisee is solely responsible for and unilaterally makes all decisions concerning my employment, including hiring, firing, discipline, supervision, staffing and scheduling. OTFF will not receive a copy of my application, will have no control over whether I receive an interview and/or am ultimately hired, does not control and is not responsible for the employment policies and practices of independent franchisees, and does not employ independent franchisee’s employees. If I am hired to work at an independent franchisee’s studio, the independent franchisee, and not OTFF, will be my employer. By submitting my application and resume, I am confirming that I am agreeing and consenting to the foregoing.



Orangetheory values your privacy, so we want to keep you informed as to how your personal information is handled. With respect to the personal information you provided in this application, that information will be submitted directly to the independent franchisee, who is solely responsible for all privacy and data protection matters related to their studio. For any inquiries regarding how the independent franchisee may collect and process your personal information, please refer to that franchisee’s privacy policy or contact them directly. For all other information about how the franchisor, OTF Franchisor, LLC or any of its affiliates (OTFF), may collect and process personal information, please https://www.orangetheory.com/en-us/privacy-policy.

title: Career Counselor - RRH (Manhattan)
description:
**About Jericho Project**

Jericho Project is a nationally acclaimed nonprofit ending homelessness at its roots by enabling homeless individuals and families to attain quality housing, employment and mental and physical health services. The 41-year-old nonprofit serves over 2,500 individuals, including 700 veterans, annually. Jericho has been a key partner in New York City’s initiative to end veterans’ homelessness, and is leading bold, innovative strategies to do the same for families and young adults.

Our programs touch four cornerstones of a person’s life: housing, employment, wellness and family stability. We create a culture of “moving on” through a foundation of housing and supportive services provided by expert program specialists and case managers.

We have over 600 units of supportive housing including 8 residences in the Bronx, Harlem, and Astoria, as well as scatter-site apartments throughout NYC.

**About the Position**

Career Counselor will provide workforce development services to Young Adults who enroll in Jericho’s programs in order to help them achieve the highest possible level of employment, educational attainment, or other meaningful activity, e.g., paid internship. The Career Counselor will work closely with the workforce development team as well as the site director and the case management staff to ensure that participant’s employment and educational goals are fully met.

**Responsibilities:**

* Provide one-on-one workforce development services to young adults enrolled in Jericho’s Rapid Re-Housing Program.
* Develop creative client engagement strategies and maintain high participant engagement in program activities.
* Conduct, at minimum, biweekly outreach to all participants and maintain related progress notes.
* Complete employment and educational assessments on all participants; ensure that assessments and service plans are updated as required.
* Identify low- and no-cost community resources and refer participants to skills training programs, HSE, ESOL and other literacy programs, college and other higher education programs, as indicated in their individual service plans.
* Assist participants in developing a job readiness portfolio, including a resume, assessment of interviewing skills, workplace attire and letters of inquiries.
* Work closely with WfO’s Employment Specialists; respond to job leads within required timeframe; identify and refer participants for matching positions via Electronic Case Management system (AWARDS).
* Assist young adults in conducting independent job search; identify new job leads as needed and make direct referrals to employers.
* Provide job retention and follow up services to employed participants.
* Access community resources to aide clients in their job search, job retention and/or re-placement efforts.
* Participate in case conferencing sessions with the case management team, as required.
* Regularly attend monthly WfO and RRH meetings.
* Maintain and update participant information in AWARDS and other data management systems as required by the funding agencies.
* Provide information related to participant engagement, employment and educational achievements, and other performance indicators as requested.
* Other responsibilities as assigned and required by the emerging needs of programs and participants.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree required.
* Knowledge and experience in providing a workforce development service in a not-for-profit setting is strongly preferred.
* Experience in program development and service delivery for young adults is desirable.
* Familiarity and comfort with the LGBTQ community and providing a safe and supportive space for LGBTQ young adults is strongly preferred.
* Ability to motivate participants to pursue employment and training within a limited time frame is essential.
* Superior written and verbal communication skills and advanced computer literacy.
* Ability to travel throughout the five boroughs.
* Working knowledge of AWARDS is highly desirable.
* Ability to assist 60 job seekers realizes desired employment and job retention outcomes.

**Compensation:**

The salary range for this position is **$48,000.00** to **$50,000.00** ***annualized***. Jericho Project offers a comprehensive benefits package. Employees are eligible for a merit increase annually. Merit increases are based on the employee’s performance during the prior year.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $48,000.00 - $50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Application Question(s):

* Do you have working knowledge of AWARDS?

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* working with the LGBTQ community: 2 years (Required)
* motivating participants to pursue employment and training: 2 years (Required)

Willingness to travel:

* 50% (Preferred)

Work Location: Multiple locations

title: FedEx Delivery Driver
description:
Joint Ops Logistics Inc, a FedEx Contractor, is seeking reliable, motivated and hardworking individuals to fill Delivery Driver positions! Join our team delivering FedEx packages in the Queens and grow with our company. In this position, you will play a key role in keeping our commitment to exceed our customer expectations and make sure customer orders, large or small, are delivered on time, at the right place.

Apply today to schedule your a virtual interview. We're making on the spot job offers! (All job offers contingent on meeting eligibility requirements.)

Responsibilities:

* Our Delivery Drivers drive a Step Van to drop off FedEx packages to customers within Rosedale, Cambria Heights and Springfield Gardens in Queens NY out of East New York FedEx Terminal.
* You can plan on working about 4-5 days a week
* A typical workday is approximately 8-10 hours
* Our drivers follow strict safety standards on and off the road
* You'll interact with FedEx customers and the public in a professional and positive manner

* Sort and load your Step Van to meet customer promise
* Ensure delivery vehicle is clean, fueled, and in good operating condition at all times
* May assist in training other team members
* May assist other Delivery team members in completing deliveries when behind

We Offer:

* Competitive Compensation
* Paid Training
* Paid time-off! (Vacation/Personal/Sick Time)
* Company Vehicle (Step Van)
* Community interaction
* Opportunity to grow with the company

Delivery Drivers must meet the following requirements:

* Must be at least 21+ years old
* Have 1 year commercial driving experience in the last 3 years with a 15' truck or similar size.
* Must have a valid driver's license within the state of employment
* Must have an acceptable Motor Vehicle Record with no points or DUIs over the last 3 years.
* Must be able to operate and navigate a Step Van, more than GVWR 10,000 lbs.
* Authorized to work in the United States
* Must be available to work weekends and holidays
* Must consent to a drug screening and pass a 5-panel drug test
* Must pass DOT Physical Test
* Must be able to lift, push, pull and move boxes up to 100 lbs., with or without a helper
* Ability to lift, bend, reach above the head, kneel, crouch, and/or stretch during shifts up to 12 hours long
* Ability to work 40 hours a week. This position is full-time
* Must have good communication skills and the ability to work well with customers

Regular Working hours: Morning shift and driver, Monday to Friday from 5:00 am to 2:00 pm; night shift, Monday to Friday from 11:00 am to 8:00 pm (including a 1-hour break). Some Saturdays at management discretion, 7:00 am to 12:00 pm. However, hours might vary according to the delivery schedule.

title: Membership Sales Advisor, Midtown
description:
**Company Description** **OUR STORY**


Equinox Group is a high growth collective of the world's most influential, experiential, and differentiated lifestyle brands. We restlessly seek what is next for maximizing life - and boldly grow the lifestyle brands and experiences that define it. In addition to Equinox, our other brands, **Blink, Pure Yoga, SoulCycle, Equinox Hotels and Equinox Media** are all recognized for inspiring and motivating members and employees to maximize life. Our portfolio of brands is recognized globally with locations within every major city across the United States in addition to London, Toronto, and Vancouver.


OUR CODE:


We are passionate about high-performance living and we practice what we preach – investing time in our own health and fitness. We believe that everyone has untapped potential within them and it takes a disruptive approach to unleash it. We dream big and don’t settle for the status quo. We sweat the details. We never accept less than 110% to help each other deliver the Equinox experience and enable our members to get great results. We are obsessed with what’s new, what’s now, what’s next. Never following, always leading, living ahead of the moment in fashion, culture and consumer behavior. We aren’t just a company; we’re a community vested in each other’s success. We value humility and a team approach at every level of the company.


If you are a high performing individual who is passionate about winning and inspiring others then we are excited to discuss career opportunities with you.

 **Job Description**  

Equinox is seeking **Membership Sales Advisors** for our state-of-the-art locations in **Midtown NYC!**


Membership Advisors are responsible for achieving or exceeding individual sales goals, renewals and ancillary service goals by pre-planning the month with strategic outreach, in-club lead generation and securing member referrals. Under the management of a General Manager, the support of a Regional Manager and a sales team of 3-4 individuals, Advisors must display, have knowledge of and participate in all the club's services, programs, and products. Advisors must keep current in knowledge of key competitors by staying abreast of trends and “shopping” competitors to compare facilities and sales trends. Above all, Advisors must have the ability to build rapport and lasting relationships with prospective and current members in order to build a strong referral base and retain members.

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Responsible for selling club memberships
* Prospect new business and clients
* Host events and workshops for in-club lead generation
* Achieve or exceed individual sales goals, renewals and ancillary service goals
* Conduct pre-planning activities each month including strategic outreach, for securing member referrals
* Build rapport and lasting relationships with prospective and current members
* Under the leadership of a General Manager, the support of a Regional Sales Manager and a sales team, Advisors must display, have knowledge of and participate in all the club's services, programs, and products

  

**Qualifications**  

* Previous sales experience preferred
* An entrepreneurial spirit
* Confidence to perform on an incentive based salary
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Enthusiastic, energetic, personable and friendly disposition
* Personal passion for health and fitness
* Enjoy working within a team
* Strong time management skills and practices
* Willing and able to work evenings, weekends and holidays
* **Pay Transparency: $17 Hourly. Variable bonus and commission plans allow for a potential total compensation of $80,000-$100,000 for reaching sales targets.**

  

**Additional Information** **AS A MEMBER OF THE EQUINOX TEAM YOU WILL RECEIVE:**

* We offer competitive salary, benefits, and industry leading commission opportunities for club employees
* Complimentary Club membership
* Perks and incentives with our products and services including Personal Training, Pilates, Spa and Shop

**NOTE**: This job description is intended to describe the general requirements for the position. It is not a complete statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements. Other duties not listed here may be assigned as necessary to ensure the proper operations of the department.


Equinox is an equal opportunity employer. For more information regarding our career opportunities, please visit one of our clubs or our website at**https://careers.equinox.com/**


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Must have a legal right to work in the United States.
