title: Nurse Practitioner
description:
**Title:** **Nurse Practitioner**
=================================

Title: Nurse Practitioner


Location: Upper East Side


Org Unit: IR Clinical 2


Work Days:


Weekly Hours: 35.00


Exemption Status: Exempt


Salary Range: $145,800.00 - $156,600.00


* As required under NYC Human Rights Law Int 1208-2018 - Salary range for this role when Hired for NYC Offices


**Position Summary**
--------------------



Responsible for direct patient care and coordination within specialty area(s). Assesses patients by means of health history and physical examination. Initiates and orders selected therapeutic and diagnostic procedures as determined by specialty area(s) following appropriate clinical protocols. Educates and councils patients as appropriate by department and specialty practice standards. Confers with physicians and other health care providers in completing and implementing appropriate patient treatment plans.


**Job Responsibilities**
------------------------


* Responsible for direct patient care on an outpatient and/or inpatient service.
* Evaluates new and/or established patients by obtaining comprehensive and focused health histories and performing both limited and complete physical examinations as appropriate.
* Orders labs, imaging, diagnostic testing, and consultations. Reviews and interprets results to develop patient care plan. Prescribes medications and therapeutic interventions as appropriate, following accepted standard of care and practice guidelines.
* Depending on department and training, performs therapeutic and diagnostic procedures.
* Enters the above in patients’ medical records in accordance with documentation best practice standards.
* Counsels/educates patients and their care providers on acute/chronic disease management, disease prevention and health promotion, considering age, education, psychosocial needs, and cultural background to ensure safe, complete, & culturally competent care.
* Confers with specialists, attending physicians, residents, nursing staff, and/or other health care providers to promote continuity of care and optimize patient outcomes.
* Participates in performance improvement and educational activities as appropriate.
* Assists in the preparation, implementation, and evaluation of research protocols when applicable.
* Performs related duties & responsibilities as determined by patient or practice needs and as required by delineation of privileges, in accordance with legal scope of practice and departmental protocols.
**Education**
-------------


* Master’s of Science Degree in Nursing
**Experience**
--------------



Approximately 2 or more years of clinical experience as an NP in a physician practice or hospital setting, preferably within a related specialty.


New graduates with related RN experience may be considered.


**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities**
-----------------------------------


* Demonstrated critical thinking and analytical skills.
* Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written).
* A team oriented individual that works collaboratively to achieve team goals.
**Licenses and Certifications**
-------------------------------


* NYS Registered Nurse Practitioner (NP) license and current NP registration
* NYS Registered Professional Nurse license and current RN registration
* Applicable National Board Certification (such as ANCC, PNCB, etc)

title: Legal Assistant/Paralegal
description:

title: Field Service Technician - Vending
description:
**Looking for a job that's as satisfying as your morning cup of joe? You're in luck! Corporate Coffee Systems is hiring, and we want YOU to be part of our Service Team!**

**CCS** is a leading New York metropolitan coffee, refreshment and breakroom supplier providing a world-class product line and Micro-Market technologies to bring that coffee-house feeling to its clients in the tri-state area. We specialize in a full line of name brand refreshment products and business supplies that our clients can trust.

**Here’s what you’ll be doing:** Based out of our midtown Manhattan Service Department, you’ll use your knowledge of basic plumbing, electricity, machinery and tools to perform emergency repairs, filter changes, troubleshooting and general preventative maintenance on coffee brewers, water coolers and other beverage-dispensing and vending equipment. Knowledge of commonly-use coffee brewers and other company equipment is a definite plus!

**What Else?**

· You’ll need to “know your way around” and be familiar with navigating transit systems/maps/directions for the New York City metropolitan area.

· Bring your positive attitude and willingness to learn. We are eager to train a quick learner who has the basic skills!

· Salary starts at $20.00 per hour.

· **Hours are Monday – Friday, 8:00am – 4:45pm** (includes a 45-minute unpaid meal break) for a 40-hour work week.

· We’ll even throw in some snazzy uniforms, a MetroCard, and the tools to do the job!

· You'll need to be able to handle a bit of heavy lifting (up to 60 pounds).

At Corporate Coffee Systems, we believe in inclusivity. Everyone is welcome here, no matter who you are or where you're from! We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations.

**So, are you ready to join the fun?**

Apply now and let's *brew up* something great together. EOE. No Agencies or phone calls please.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Fuel card
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Tools provided
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
Overview:  
We are seeking a highly skilled and customer-focused Customer Service Representative to join our team. As the primary point of contact for our customers, you will be responsible for resolving customer inquiries, addressing concerns, and providing exceptional service experiences. If you are passionate about delivering top-notch customer service and are proficient in multiple languages, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Duties:  
- Respond to customer inquiries via phone, email, or chat, addressing their concerns and resolving issues in a timely and professional manner.  
- Analyze customer needs and provide tailored solutions to meet their expectations.  
- Utilize data entry skills to accurately document customer interactions and update relevant records.  
- Conduct outbound calls to follow up with customers and ensure they are satisfied with our services.  
- Demonstrate excellent phone etiquette and communication skills to maintain a positive and respectful tone.  
- Identify opportunities to upsell or cross-sell our products or services, ensuring customers receive the best possible value.  
- Communicate effectively in multiple languages, including English and Spanish.  
- Collaborate with other teams to resolve complex customer issues and ensure customer satisfaction.

Qualifications:  
- Proven experience in customer service roles, with a focus on resolving customer inquiries and addressing concerns.  
- Strong analytical skills, with the ability to analyze customer needs and provide effective solutions.  
- Proficiency in data entry, with the ability to accurately document customer interactions.  
- Excellent phone etiquette and communication skills.  
- Ability to conduct outbound calls and engage with customers in a professional manner.  
- Strong sales skills, with the ability to upsell or cross-sell our products or services.  
- Fluency in English and Spanish, with the ability to communicate effectively in multiple languages.  
- Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and prioritize tasks effectively.  
- Commitment to delivering exceptional customer service experiences and ensuring customer satisfaction.

title: Medical Assistant
description:
Sun River Health provides the highest quality of comprehensive primary, preventative and behavioral health services to all who see it, regardless of insurance status and ability to pay, especially for the underserved and vulnerable. Sun River Health is a Federally Qualified, Non-Profit Health Center serving communities in Suffolk, Rockland, Orange, Dutchess, Ulster, Sullivan, Columbia and Westchester County. Sun River Health is currently seeking a full-time Medical Assistant at to support our Amityville location.


A Medical Assistant helps patients and the clinical team at designated health center in support of medical care as directed by the nursing and medical staff and pursuant to the objectives and policies of the Center. This position performs job duties in compliance with systems and job specific standards and additional jobs or duties assigned.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities of a Medical Assistant:


* Completes the rooming process and takes vital signs, vision, and/or hearing tests, record patient data in eCW, (laboratory results, pain level, PEAS, PhQ, Smoke status, etc.) Document reason for visit.
* Perform in-house labs, collect specimens for out-side labs (ex. Pap, cultures, etc) perform quality control in accordance with organizational protocols.
* Keeps clinical area stocked and in good order. Assures that all dated material is kept current and disposes of outdated supplies.
* Cleans and sterilizes all equipment and logs each time this service is performed.
* Perform basic clerical work in service area; answer phones in appropriate manner, communicate problems/concerns to nurse; handle telephone inquires
* Ensures all appropriate logs are maintained.

Minimum Education Requirement: High School diploma/ GED with Medical Assistant Training Certificate
  

  

Preferred Education Requirement: Associate's degree with Medical Assistant Training Certificate


Minimum Related Work Experience: 0-1 year


Preferred Specialized Skills & Knowledge: Bilingual Spanish is preferred


Sun River Health is a network of over 40 Federally Qualified Health Centers (FQHCs) providing primary, dental, pediatric, OB-GYN, and behavioral health care to over 245,000 patients annually. With a dedicated staff of 2,000 doctors, nurses, and health care professionals, we pride ourselves on delivering high-quality, affordable care to those who need it most. Sun River Health started in 1975 when four African American mothers spearheaded efforts to open our first health center in Peekskill, New York to deliver accessible, high-quality, affordable services to patients in need no matter their race, religion, income, or insurance status. Today, after 45 years of service, Sun River Health is still delivering on that promise to communities across the Hudson Valley, New York City, and Long Island.  



Job Type: Full-time


Pay: $19.00 - $22.00 per hour
company_description: At Sun River Health, we believe that quality, complete health care is for everyone, no matter what you can pay.

title: Director of Community Resources
description:
**Mission & Agency Overview**

**Safe provides our clients and their families counseling and support in dealing with addiction and educates our community and the public broadly about the dangers of addiction and how it may best be prevented.** 

**Job Description:**

The Director of Community Resources is the primary liaison between Safe’s outpatient clinic and community members, complementary organizations and potential clients throughout NYC. The Director of Community Resources plays the leading role in raising awareness about services available at Safe’s outpatient clinic with a view to ensuring that all who can benefit are introduced to the facility. The professional also arranges assistance for clients that would benefit from alternative and additional services and cultivates and maintains relationships with many organizations with which Safe partners for purposes of referrals and coordination. The professional also coordinates extensively with Safe’s Intake Coordinator, therapists and administrative staff to foster best practices and ensure that clients are afforded maximum access to resources.

**Job Responsibilities include but are not limited to:** 

* Develop and execute a creative and comprehensive outreach plan.
* Meet periodically with clients regarding resources to support recovery.
* Establish and maintain relationships with representatives from other service providers (rehabs, detox, mental health providers, etc.).
* Maintain an up-to-date referral directory of resources and for clients and others requiring forms of care that differ from Safe’s offerings.
* Assist clients graduating from Safe in developing post-treatment plans.
* Develop and manage a program for peer support.
* Conduct or arrange training for staff.
* Complete all related administrative work and documentation in accordance with OASAS and Safe regulations.

**Skills/Credentials:** 

* Proven ability to perform outreach
* Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues inside and outside the agency to achieve goals
* Strong interpersonal skills, public speaking experience a plus
* Creativity, resourcefulness, proactive mind-set, team mentality, empathy
* Preference for a Certified Recovery Peer Advocates (CRPA) or a CASAC with an active New York License (or have CASAC-T and be eligible for New York State CASAC license)
* Familiarity with the 12-step and SMART Recovery models preferred

**Job type**:

* Full time

title: VP/SVP, Business Development
description:
**Employment Status:** Full-Time


**About Sapience Therapeutics**


Sapience Therapeutics, Inc. is a privately held, clinical-stage biotechnology company focused on discovering and developing peptide therapeutics to address oncogenic and immune dysregulation that drive cancer. With in-house discovery capabilities, Sapience has built a pipeline of therapeutic candidates called SPEARs™ (Stabilized Peptides Engineered Against Regulation) that disrupt intracellular protein-protein interactions, enabling targeting of transcription factors which have traditionally been considered undruggable, and can deliver cargo to cell surface targets with their new class of molecule called SPARCs™ (Stabilized Peptides Against Receptors on Cancer), enabling delivery of payloads such as α-particles to cancer cells. Sapience is advancing its lead programs, ST316, a first-in-class antagonist of β-catenin, and ST101, a first-in-class antagonist of C/EBPβ, through Phase 1-2 clinical trials.


**The Opportunity**


Reporting to our Chief Executive Officer, we are seeking an experienced BD professional/executive with broad domain knowledge in the clinical sciences to lead, independently and strategically, Sapience’s business development functions. Core responsibilities include partnering and licensing Sapience assets, negotiating terms/contracts, and providing strategic direction for BD efforts and internal programs. You will leverage your aptitude and passion for science as you quickly gain deep understanding of the key scientific questions for any given opportunity and communicate these to other senior leaders and to the board of directors. You have skill in connecting both internally and with outside parties and extensive experience negotiating complex deal structures.


The successful candidate will be highly motivated, resourceful, flexible and a quick learner. As a critical member of our management team, your leadership style will complement the culture of the organization. You, along with the CEO, CFO and scientific leadership, will be an integral person involved in evaluating internal and external opportunities, and leading partnering discussions. Title will be commensurate with level of experience.


This role is located in our corporate office in Tarrytown, NY and the preference is for onsite in-person collaboration. However, a hybrid schedule will be considered.


**Responsibilities:**


* Independently spearhead global business development activities consistent with Sapience’s overall internal and external innovation strategies set by the CEO, executive management team, and board of directors.
* Lead out-licensing initiatives to identify potential partners for certain Sapience assets or platforms.
* Run partnership discussion processes including direct ownership and oversight of due diligence, drafting and negotiating term sheets, working closely with legal team on negotiating collaboration agreements, and collecting feedback from various internal stakeholders.
* Lead, guide and direct teams responsible for organizing and completing extensive due diligence involving cross-functional teams of several internal and external experts. Diligence areas include but are not limited to scientific, clinical, manufacturing, regulatory, marketing, financial, legal, IP experts.
* Lead and collaborate on business aspects of complex contract negotiations with internal and external legal counsel as needed.
* Working closely with Sapience’s finance team and external experts, including investment bankers, oversee the creation and evolution of financial models that inform the valuation of external opportunities.
* Create strategic and compelling slide decks of the highest consistency and quality and use them in presenting opportunities to third parties, the CEO, executive management team, and board of directors.
* Additional responsibilities may include those related to enabling and maintaining operational effectiveness across the entire organization (which includes strategy, business development, alliance management, commercial, and public-private partnerships).
* Support the CEO and CFO on projects as needed and collaborate closely with other senior leaders across the company.


**Qualifications**:


* Advanced medical and/or scientific degree (MD, PhD, or both) required.
* 10+ years’ experience including at least 5-8 years’ experience in business development, with significant deal & negotiations experience at biopharma or related life sciences companies. Experience in the areas of oncology and immuno-oncology.
* Strong capabilities in strategic analysis and communication, both written and verbal, including creating and presenting compelling slide decks.
* Demonstrated track record of leading and negotiating complex transactions at pace while managing competing priorities.
* A thorough understanding of the processes of due diligence, asset valuation, and portfolio management, combined with deep scientific and business acumen.
* Successful track record in independently sourcing, evaluating, prioritizing, and pursuing the partnering of clinical-stage assets, preclinical assets, and research platforms.
* Well networked in biopharma, life science, and VC communities.
* Extensive experience in managing and optimizing partnerships through deal execution and afterwards.
* Possesses strong analytical, quantitative, and financial skills, including facility with financial models and reading and understanding financial statements and SEC documents. Experience in venture capital investing or investment banking a plus.


**What We Offer**


* The expected salary range for this position is $250,000.00 to $400,000.00. Actual pay and title will be determined based on experience and qualifications.
* Compensation and benefits are aligned with the current market and commensurate with the person’s experience and qualifications. Full-time employees receive a package that includes: compensation, stock options as well as many other Sapience benefits such as: health, dental, vision, and disability insurance benefits, paid time off, company shut down for holidays, and 401K match.
* A diverse and inclusive culture where ideas are shared and your authentic self is welcome.
* Exceptional, collaborative, and dedicated team.
* The opportunity to participate in work which may have a transformational impact on patients’ lives.


**How to Apply**


Please submit your CV, deal sheet and cover letter in PDF format to careers@sapiencetherapeutics. Please indicate the position title in the subject line of your email. We will contact you should we wish to arrange a meeting to discuss this position further.


Sapience Therapeutics is an equal opportunity employer. We recognize the power and importance of a diverse employee population and strongly encourage applicants with various experiences and backgrounds.

title: Registered Nurse - Pediatrics
description:
Join our vibrant team at our brand-new, state-of-the-art facility Acute Care Facility!

Day & Night Shifts Available: Day Shift: 6:00 AM – 6:30 PM / Night Shift: 6:00 PM – 6:30 AM

Part-Time: 2-3 days per week / Full-Time: 4 days a week

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $48.00 – $70.00 per hour

To work as an RN in an inpatient pediatric acute care setting in New York, several key clinical skills are essential:

· **Critical care expertise**: RNs should be proficient in managing critically ill pediatric patients, including those requiring respiratory assistance, cardiac monitoring, and administration of vasoactive drugs.

· **Respiratory care**: Skills in managing patients needing endotracheal intubation, mechanical ventilation, CPAP, BiPAP, and frequent nebulized medications are crucial.

· **Cardiovascular monitoring**: Ability to monitor and interpret dysrhythmias and manage patients with cardiovascular issues.

· **Neurological assessment**: Competence in assessing and caring for patients with altered mental status, acute CNS inflammation or infections, and moderate to severe head injuries.

· **Sepsis management**: Knowledge and skills to recognize and treat severe sepsis or septic shock in pediatric patients.

· **Metabolic disorder management**: Ability to care for patients with conditions like diabetic ketoacidosis and inborn errors of metabolism.

· **Post-surgical care**: Expertise in managing patients who have undergone various surgical procedures, including thoracic, cardiovascular, airway, and craniofacial surgeries.

· **Trauma care**: Skills in caring for patients with multiple traumatic injuries, including major thoracic or abdominal trauma.

· **Multidisciplinary collaboration**: Ability to work effectively as part of a multidisciplinary team, including physicians, respiratory therapists, pharmacists, nutritionists, and social workers.

· **Patient-family centered care**: Competence in employing a patient-family centered approach, allowing patients and their families to have an active role in the care process.

· **Pediatric-specific expertise**: In-depth understanding of pediatric physiology, pharmacology, and age-appropriate care techniques.

· **Invasive procedures**: Familiarity with and ability to assist in various invasive procedures common in pediatric acute care settings.

These skills ensure that RNs can provide high-quality care to critically ill and injured pediatric patients in acute care settings in New York, meeting the state's standards for pediatric intensive care units.

**Responsibilities**  
- Provide direct patient care to pediatric patients, including assessments, catheterization, IV insertion, and tube feeding.  
- Utilize EMR and EHR systems for accurate documentation and patient care coordination.  
- Demonstrate expertise in pediatric physiology and patient assessment to deliver high-quality care.  
- Collaborate with healthcare team members to ensure comprehensive and individualized patient treatment.  
- Stay updated on best practices and advancements in pediatric nursing to enhance patient outcomes.  
- Engage in health coaching and education for patients and families to promote wellness and recovery.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $48.00 - $70.00 per hour

* Flexible schedule

* Acute care

* Overtime pay

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

* RN: 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:

title: Associate Director, Derivatives Middle Office
description:
**About Clear Street:**  

Clear Street is building modern infrastructure for capital markets. Founded in 2018 by top Wall Street and Silicon Valley veterans, Clear Street is an independent, non-bank prime broker designed to solve the industry's most neglected problem: legacy technology.



We have built a proprietary, cloud-native clearing and custody system from the ground floor to replace the outdated infrastructure used across capital markets. Our platform is fully integrated with central clearing houses and exchanges to support billions in trading volume per day. We've agonized about our data model abstractions, created horizontal scalability, and crafted thoughtful APIs. All so we can provide a best-in-class experience for our clients.



By combining highly-skilled product and engineering talent with seasoned finance professionals, we're building the essentials to compete in today's fast-paced markets.


**The Role:**  

We are looking for a Middle Office Vice President / Associate Director to work as part of the Clear Street Derivatives team. Clear Street operates both a FINRA registered Broker/Dealer and a SEC regulated Securities Based Swap Dealer. This role will be focused on supporting colleagues and our counterparties in the middle office function across both entities. You will be a part of the Derivatives Middle Office team and work in partnership with the Derivatives Product and engineering teams to define an end to end operation environment for Derivatives.


* You will perform daily Middle Office responsibilities, such as:
	+ Interact directly with clients
	+ Perform reconciliations and investigate breaks/discrepancies
	+ Prepare trade confirmations and regulatory reporting
	+ Book trades, cash flows, and corporate actions
	+ Manage cashflows (processing and/or settlement of PnL, collateral, interest, etc.)
	+ Process expiries and lifecycle events
* Build and maintain client relationships, and serving as a liaison between clients and prime brokers/counterparties
* You will participate in various audits and regulator reviews
* You will learn new applications and help test integrations
* You will work closely with the Trading Desk, Sales, Compliance, Legal and Finance teams
* You will contribute to process improvement and the general operation of the team, swap dealer, and group


**Experience / Skills:**


* At least five (5) years of professional experience working within a Middle Office Derivatives role covering trade settlements, fail control, reconciliations of trade discrepancies, and client servicing; previous experience working for a Securities Based Swap Dealer is highly preferred
* Prior experience with various products including equities, fixed income, repurchase agreements, futures, FX, options and working knowledge of Corporate Actions
* Experience working with large data sets
* Proficiency in Excel (VBA a plus)


**Bonus:**


* Experience with sell-side OTC derivatives
* Understanding of security-based swaps regulations, and regulatory reporting
* Experience dealing with Auditors and Regulators

  

  

**We offer:**


* The opportunity to join a small and growing team of good people, where you can make a difference
* A meritocratic philosophy that champions collaboration
* Room to innovate, solve complex business problems, and build new products
* Competitive compensation, benefits, and perks


The Base Salary Range for this role is $125,000 - $175,000. This range is representative of the starting base salaries for this role at Clear Street. Where a candidate falls in this range will be based on job related factors such as relevant experience, skills, and location. This range represents Base Salary only, which is just one element of Clear Street's total compensation. The range stated does not include other factors of total compensation such as bonuses or equity.



At Clear Street, we offer competitive compensation packages, company equity, 401k matching, gender neutral parental leave, and full medical, dental and vision insurance. Our belief has always been that we are better as a business when we are all together in person. As such, beginning on January 2, 2023, we are requiring employees to be in the office 4 days per week. In-office benefits include lunch stipends, fully stocked kitchens, happy hours, a great location, and amazing views.



Our top priority is our people. We're continuously investing in a culture that promotes collaboration. We help each other through challenges and celebrate each other's successes. We believe that modern workplaces succeed by virtue of having high-performance workforces that are diverse — in ideas, in cultures, and in experiences. We put in the effort to make such a workplace a daily reality and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. #LI-Hybrid

title: Manager, Operations Engineering
description:
**About Liberty**

At Liberty Coca-Cola, we strive to make our workforce as inclusive and diverse as the communities we serve. Our associates are our #1 asset, and we are committed to investing in our people, maintaining the highest safety standing: Medical, Dental, Vision, Prescription drug plans, 401K with company contributions, paid vacation, company paid holidays, and more. Discover what it means to be energized by a multitude of possibilities and a dynamic team. Join us here at Liberty Coca-Cola Beverages LLC.

**Summary**

Directly lead and coordinate the site engineering team’s daily and long-range activities, ensuring the team’s skills, competencies, and performance consistently meets business objectives. Ensure resources are properly deployed against both short term production responses and long-range strategic goals. Demonstrate and promote LIBERTY COCA-COLA’s core values through their team while ensuring the safety of our people, workplace and environment and meeting all company, legal and other requirements.

**Responsibilities**

* Directly lead and coordinate the site engineering team’s daily and long-range activities, ensuring the team’s skills, competencies, and performance consistently meets business objectives. Ensure resources are properly deployed against both short term production responses and long-range strategic goals. Demonstrate and promote LIBERTY COCA-COLA’s core values through their team.
* Actively participate in the site’s daily performance monitoring and reporting cycle. Partner with operations leadership on root cause investigations and solution development to overcome performance issues (OEE, Safety, Quality).
* In collaboration with the Sr. Director of Engineering, define, propose, and monitor the implementation of Safety, Quality, and Engineering Standards within the site. Through ownership of the Site’s Equipment/Process Management of Change (MOC) program, guide the engineering, maintenance, facilities, and operations teams in the proper reviews, work processes, and procedures required to execute changes within the site.
* Propose and maintain Engineering expense budgets as well as the factory's capital investment plans. The Site Engineering Manager will plan and manage all approved capital projects executed by themselves or their team.
* Contribute toward the Strategic and Tactical Leadership of the factory driving a Total Productive Maintenanc culture including implementation of the Early Management Pillar. This includes up front collaboration with R&D on new product introductions as well as standalone installation and startup of new assets.
* Drive the implementation of Maintenance Best Practices and a Risk Based Maintenance (RBM) approach. Optimize Predictive Maintenance technologies (Condition Monitoring and inspections) to minimize unplanned downtime. Partner with the maintenance teams to utilize planned downtime for major equipment inspections and or overhauls.
* Initiate and coordinate the implementation of new processes/technologies, including partnership with the Digital Team in the implementation of new platform solutions.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering - Electrical, Industrial or Mechanical or 1-3 years experience managing technical teams, while planning and executing commercialization and/or capital projects in a manufacturing setting.
* The ideal candidate will have an in-depth knowledge of maintenance technologies, and operation of utilities in order to support day to day operations, water systems and future projects
* Knowledge of beverage safety, regulatory requirements for safety and hygienic engineering design (OSHA, SQF, FDA, EPA, DEC)
* Experience implementing and administrating engineering programs required.
* Experience with Batch and Continuous Processing and/or High-speed packaging equipment experience required; food and/or beverage manufacturing experience a plus.
* Working knowledge and experience of water systems (RO Purification and UF Purification).

**Knowledge, Skills And Abilities**

* Strong project management skills including planning, risk analysis and mitigation, prioritization, and resource management
* CAPEX budgeting, preparation, and execution
* Physical Asset and Maintenance Management including implementation of TPM Early Management programs
* Industrial Services and Energy Management (NEMT)
* Strong knowledge of processing equipment such as blending vessels, pumps, homogenizers, and thermal processing (HTST/UHT)
* Able to apply root cause problem solving to systemically resolve complex short term and long-term issues and opportunities (RCCA Processes)
* Strong organization and multi-tasking skills – ability to balance and prioritize several projects simultaneously
* Language Ability: Ability to read, write and interpret documents in English such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions and procedure manuals. Ability to ready, understand, and modify P&ID’s is required.

**Computer Skills**

AutoCAD experience is required for equipment layouts and maintenance of the site master plan, SOLIDWORKS.

**Additional Information**

Liberty Coca-Cola Beverages LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

​For additional information, please visit our company website at http://www.libertycoke.com/!

title: Employment Counselor
description:
**Job Overview**

Provide client service support to participants (General Assistance/Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program, and Temporary Assistance for Needy Families) in accordance to rules and regulations. Responsibilities include, but are not limited, to the following activities:

· Conduct client intake, determine work readiness of clients through assessment and evaluation.

· Provide assistance to clients through the development of an Individual Responsibility Plan (IRP), Comprehensive Social Assessment (CSA), and other critical documents for client review and signature.

· Ensure that clients have the appropriate and required mix of activities to meet work requirements. Refer to work activities and determine the need for other supportive services.

· Provide career and employment counseling.

· Document pertinent information on client progress in counselor notes.

· Maintain confidential, thorough, documented files on clients.

· Process timesheets.

· Follow-up and monitor client participation in required work activities.

· Coordinate with One-Stop Career Center, Social Services staff and other community agencies and service providers.

· Recommend sanctioning action for clients not in compliance with required activities.

· Attend Fair Hearings as required.

· Represent Employment and Training Services at meetings and other functions.

· Perform other duties as required.

**Qualifications:**

§ College degree / social services or equivalent

§ Previous social / human services experience

description:
**FULL TIME DSP POSITIONS - 4 day work week!! No Weekends!!**

**On-demand pay available -** ***Work today, get paid today!***

***Agency Holidays and Weekends off!*** 

**Ready to join our 4,000+ employees in a career at YAI?**

Working at YAI means effecting real change in people's lives. It means going home at the end of the day knowing you have helped someone accomplish a goal. If you want a career supporting others, creatively finding solutions to life's challenges, and building a more inclusive community, YAI is the place for you!

**We are hiring people for our Brentwood & Coram Day Hab locations.**  The ideal candidate should possess a wide range of skills and are eager to promote YAI's mission of supporting people with intellectual and developmental disabilities to live, love, work, and learn at our **Brentwood & Coram Day Habs** in the community.

**About the Position:**

Direct Support Professionals (DSPs) work closely with people of all ages who have intellectual and developmental disabilities (I/DD). Depending on the supports needed, DSPs may work in a person’s home, in their family’s home, in a YAI residence, at a day habilitation center, or out in the community.

**Qualifications and Requirements:**

· High School Diploma or GED

· Work or life experience in the I/DD field is a plus but not mandatory

· Ability to complete three to five weekdays of paid New York State-mandated OPWDD training during normal business hours

· Tuberculosis (TB) testing is mandatory for most positions (and is provided free of charge by our partnership with CityMD)

· Driver's license required for majority of locations

title: Customer Service Representative (Client Care)
description:
**Looking for a job that's more than just a job? You're in luck!** 

**Corporate Coffee Systems is hiring, and we want YOU to be part of our Top-Notch Customer Service Team!**

Corporate Coffee Systems is a leading New York metropolitan coffee and refreshment supplier which provides a world-class product line and the latest technology to bring that coffee-house feeling to its clients in the tri-state area. We specialize in a full line of name brand refreshment products and business supplies that you can trust.

**Here’s what you’ll be doing:** Reporting to the Client Care Manager at our Westbury, NY location, the ideal Client Care Associate will bring their customer service skills and experience to (but not limited to):

· Answer incoming client calls, take and process orders, and support ACD/Chatlines for prompt intake of orders, inquiries, complaints and client requests

· Assist clients and related departments with order tracking and shipping information, supporting all departments/teams with the order fulfillment cycle, including all order/service-related communications

· Generate order forms in collaboration with Sales Dept. for accounts use of new order submittal

· Arrange service calls and problem-solve client issues

· Research/confirm missed shipments, refusals, mis-picks and returns, along with maintenance of client contact information integrity within the order database.

· Maintain open lines of pre-emptive communications pertaining to credit issuance/validation, backorders, missed stops, today’s install, service calls on hold and accounts in collections status.

· Maintain organized COI department files, updated special handling territory portfolios and auto weekly, biweekly and monthly water tracking account calendars.

· Monitor top 30 account order history for daily outreaches in securing orders.

Our Client Care Department is a valued partner, playing a pivotal role in delivering excellent customer service, significantly impacting our customer relationships and satisfaction. **If you are a customer service Star, come shine at Corporate Coffee Systems!**

**What Else?**

· You’ll need a minimum of 1 Year Call Center Customer Service experience (in a refreshment and/or office supply is a plus).

· Excellent oral and written communication skills, with ability to follow instructions.

· Exhibit excellent professionalism and telephone etiquette with clients, managers and team members

· Ability to resolve low-priority issues without supervision.

· Eagerness to continually increase your knowledge and understanding of Corporate Coffee Systems products, their functionality and use.

· Working knowledge of MS Office applications, including Excel and Outlook.

· High-energy, flexible, self-starter, hands-on, and comfortable working individually and in a team environment.

· **We offer a great opportunity and potential for additional commission-based compensation.** 

· Hours are Monday – Friday, 8:30am – 5:00pm. If you can start in August, you’ll be in time to enjoy our Summertime schedule/hours, allowing an early close on Fridays!

At Corporate Coffee Systems, we believe in inclusivity. Everyone is welcome here, no matter who you are or where you're from! We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations. EOE. No Agencies or phone calls please.

title: Education Initiatives Manager
company: The College and Community Foundation, Inc.
description:
The College and Community Fellowship Inc (CCF) helps women with justice involvement to obtain college degrees and career certifications, allowing them, as well as their families and communities, to thrive. Established in 2000, CCF aims to create a world where everyone has equal access to opportunities, regardless of their criminal legal histories.

The College and Community Fellowship, Inc. (CCF) is seeking an Education Initiatives Manager to join our team. We are interested in a self-starter, who is committed to galvanizing human resources to amplify and co-create boundless opportunities for all women marginalized through incarceration.

The Education Initiatives Manager will design and facilitate a technical assistance curriculum to train higher education faculty on engaging and supporting justice-involved students, thus improving their retention and graduation rates. This role involves securing contracts with higher education institutes, developing K-12 curricula for justice-impacted youth, training teachers on social-emotional strategies, and delivering workshops to CCF participants and incarcerated women on navigating public school systems.

**Key Responsibilities:** 

* Design and deliver a curriculum to train higher education faculty on creating safe, inclusive spaces and fostering a culture of success for justice-involved students.
* Establish and maintain contacts with higher education and K-12 institutions to secure training and workshop contracts.
* Design or oversee the development of a K-12 curriculum to support justice-involved youth.
* Train K-12 teachers to address the social-emotional needs of students impacted by trauma and parental incarceration.
* Conduct workshops for CCF participants and incarcerated women on public school navigation, including special education and advocacy.
* Collect feedback through surveys, focus groups, and other qualitative research methods to inform program development.
* Supervise, as well as provide evaluations of interns and team members assigned to support the work.

**Mindset:** 

* **Growth Mindset**: Identify new learning areas and create learning opportunities.
* **Self-motivation**: Proactively take initiative, identify problems and opportunities, develop recommendations, and act on those recommendations.
* **Adaptability**: Thrive in an ambiguous environment with autonomy to drive your work.
* **Developing Others**: Plan and support the development of individuals’ skills and abilities.

**Qualifications:** 

* Bachelor's degree in education, master's degree preferred.
* 7+ years of teaching experience in K-12 and higher education combined.
* Justice involvement experience preferred.
* Experience in curriculum design, professional development, and workshop facilitation, preferably in education or the non-profit sector.
* Understanding of the challenges faced by justice-impacted individuals and their unique needs within educational settings.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships and collaborate with diverse stakeholders.
* Excellent organizational and project management abilities, with the capacity to prioritize tasks and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Experience conducting surveys, focus groups, and other qualitative research methods to gather feedback and inform program development.
* Commitment to creating inclusive, supportive learning environments and promoting social emotional learning.
* Passion for social justice and equity, with a dedication to supporting marginalized communities and driving positive change.

If you are passionate about education, community engagement, and making a difference in the lives of justice-impacted individuals, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Persons with an arrest and conviction history are encouraged to apply. We look forward to receiving your application!

**Company Description**  

The world’s largest artisanal Italian food and beverage marketplace is coming to New Jersey! Eataly will open in 2024 in the Mall at Short Hills. Eataly was founded in Italy in 2007 and has since expanded to more than 40 locations (and counting!) across the globe. Each Eataly is different, with its own character and own theme – but all with the same aim... for our guests to:

* EAT authentic Italian food at our restaurants, cafés and to-go counter
* SHOP a selection of high-quality Italian, local and homemade products
* LEARN through our classes and our team’s product knowledge

  

**Job Description**  

The Warehouse Lead oversees the day-to-day operations of the Warehouse department: receiving, tracking and inspecting all deliveries for quality and accuracy. Reports to the Warehouse Manager.

* Plans, organizes and supervises the operations of the warehouse and team during assigned shifts
* Manages warehouse stock, ensuring proper storage and safe, timely and cleanly retrieval and delivery
* Organizes stock systematically so it is accessible, identifiable, stored at proper temperature and countable
* Maintains store-wide inventory of collateral and supplies
* Collects, organizes and sends documentation arriving with shipments to the Inventory Control (IC) Associate
* Maintains records to shipment loading and unloading, transfer of goods, etc.
* Stocks merchandise; receives, prepares, distributes and reorders internal orders

* 2+ years of retail stock or warehouse supervisory experience

* Availability to work onsite with a flexible schedule often including nights and weekends

**Immigration Paralegal**

Jihi Law Group LLC, located in Englewood Cliffs, NJ is seeking a skilled professional to support our immigration law practice. The position offers the opportunity to work under the supervision of experienced attorneys on various immigration cases.

**Overview:**  
As an Immigration Paralegal, you will play a crucial role in assisting the managing attorney with various tasks related to immigration law. Your responsibilities will include preparing immigration forms, supporting documentation, and court filings. You will also be responsible for conducting legal research, updating case management systems, and communicating with clients.

**Responsibilities:**

* Assist attorneys in preparing and filing immigration petitions and applications, including forms and support letters for non-immigrant and immigrant visa petition filings with the USCIS.

* Utilize document management systems for efficient organization of case files.
* Support attorneys in drafting legal documents such as petitions, motions, and responses.
* Assist with document review and maintain confidentiality of client information.
* Translate documents from English to Korean and vice versa.

* Strong administrative skills and familiarity with document management systems to organize case files effectively.
* Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills, both written and oral (able to communicate in both English and Korean).
* Previous experience as a paralegal in a law office setting.
* Ability to work under pressure and meet strict deadlines.
* Strong proficiency with Microsoft Office applications and familiarity with office machinery including copiers, fax, and scanners.

If you are a detail-oriented individual with a passion for immigration law and possess the required skills, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity to grow your career as an Immigration Paralegal at Jihi Law Group LLC.

* Experience in developing and implementing Environmental Health and Safety programs, procedures, associated training, guidance documents and job aids with cross functional teams.
* Expertise in city and state-wide regulatory requirements.
* Ability to manage multiple projects and perform in a complex, motivational environment.
* Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.

**About the job**
-----------------


Security is at the core of Google's design and development process: it is built into the DNA of our products. The same is true of our offices. You're an expert who shares our seriousness about security and our commitment to confidentiality. You'll collaborate with our Facilities Management team to create innovative security strategies, investigate breaches and create risk assessment plans for the future. You believe that providing effective security doesn't come at the expense of customer service - you will be our bodyguard (and our long lost pal).



In this role, you will beleading an environmental, health and safety (EHS) culture that protects the well-being of our people, partners, enterprise, and planet to grow. Your mission is to understand key business needs and strive to develop and implement scalable policies and programs that prioritize health, safety, and the environment.


Also in this role, you will work with local teams and regional leaders by providing consultative expertise on EHS topics and ensuring compliance with regional and local regulations as well as being the conduit to surface emerging challenges and business priorities. We interact with all elements of the business with a focus on building an EHS program.


From keeping Googlers safe and secure to managing disruptive events, the ability to anticipate, deter, detect, and act are the pillars of Google’s Global Security and Resilience Services (GSRS) team. As a member of GSRS you will help develop a culture where safety, security and resiliency are integrated into every facet of Google, including the creative process. You will help us continually identify, evaluate and monitor enterprise risks that could affect business activities and provide business leaders the information they need to make critical decisions. You'll collaborate with cross-functional teams to create innovative strategies and develop programs that drive sustainable effectiveness.


The US base salary range for this full-time position is $122,000-$180,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process

  

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Collaborate across multiple teams in all aspects of EHS operations throughout multiple Google campuses.
* Implement partner to facilities, operations, security, product areas, and business unit leaders in all aspects of global EHS operations and emergency preparedness.
* Partner with building operation teams on management solutions in compliance with regulatory requirements.
* Develop analytics and reports based on metrics gathered from injury, illness, hazard and inspection data.
* Provide expertise and advise on a variety of EHS topics and workplace safety such as indoor air quality, environmental compliance, and emergency response
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

title: Field Sales Representative, Enterprise Greenfield, Google Cloud
description:
### **Minimum qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 10 years of experience with quota-carrying cloud or software sales, or account management at a Business-to-Business (B2B) software company.
* Experience prospecting, or building customer relationships from scratch.

  

### **Preferred qualifications:**

* Experience promoting cloud solutions, infrastructure software, databases, analytic tools, or applications software across multiple industries, aligning technology solutions to drive high value business outcomes.
* Experience acquiring new logos at scale and securing the foundational workloads to accelerate the consumption business.
* Experience working with, and leading cross-functional internal teams (e.g., Business Development, Customer Engineers, Partner Sales) and external partners in complex implementation projects and negotiations.
* Experience in building and maintaining C-level relationships to promote cloud solutions.
* Ability to influence at the executive level.

**About the job**
-----------------


The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are developed for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.



As a Field Sales Representative (FSR), you will focus on new customer acquisition for enterprise accounts. You will be responsible to grow Google Cloud’s market share by acquiring new logos and securing the foundational workloads to accelerate their consumption business. You will lead the engagement with a diverse group of cross-industry enterprise customers and assist them in solving their business issues with our solutions. You will identify specific business problems working with stakeholders across accounts, and partnering with an extended team to develop technical solutions to solve them. You will also be responsible for building relationships across various levels with customers, developers and C-suite executives. Additionally, you will also lead a cross-functional team and leverage the right resources, including customer engineering, business development, cross-functional promoters, and partners to maximize outcomes.

  

Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.


The US base salary range for this full-time position is $110,000-$164,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.


Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google.
**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Lead prospects and acquisition of new logos, create and build customer relationships from scratch, and establish as a trusted advisor on their long-term technology and business decisions.
* Be an expert on the customers business, including their SaaS product portfolio, technology strategy, strategic growth plans, business drivers, financial structure, customer base, vertical market offering and engaged landscape.
* Lead account strategy to develop business growth opportunities, work cross-functionally with multiple teams and Google partners to maximize business impact within enterprise customers.
* Manage business cycles presenting to C-level executives and negotiating terms.
* Drive business development, own operational excellence at scale, forecast accurately, and achieve strategic goals by leading customers through the entire business cycle.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

title: Dermatology Medical Assistant
description:
Description:
**Advanced Dermatology, P.C. is seeking an experienced Medical Assistant to come on board Full Time in our West Islip office!**

**Position Summary**  

The Medical Assistant provides administrative and clinical support to licensed medical providers, as allowable by  

law, to ensure appropriate patient care and efficient office operations. A Certified (Registered) Medical Assistant  

supports providers and patients by handling various patient-care tasks related to management, organization, and  

communication. The position requires accuracy, quality work, compassion, and timeliness, while attending to  

patient needs.

**Key Roles & Responsibilities**  

* Welcomes patients by greeting them, introducing themselves.
* Prepares patients for the visit by directing and/or accompanying them to the examination room; providing


examination gowns and drape; helping them position themselves for the examination and/or treatment;  

monitoring instruments, supplies, and equipment.  

* Verifies patient information by interviewing patient; reviewing and/or recording medical history; taking vital


signs; confirming purpose of visit or treatment.  

* Supports patient-care by helping providers during examinations; preparing specimens; performing basic


laboratory tests on site; disposing of contaminated supplies; sterilizing medical instruments; authorizing drug  

refills as directed; calling in prescriptions to pharmacies; removing sutures; changing dressings.  

* Enters patients' vital statistics and information such as medications, test results, radiology, and laboratory


orders into the Electronic Health Record. (EMA)  

* Updates and files medical records and insurance reports
* Assists during medical examinations, as allowable by law
* Maintains patient confidence and protects operations by keeping patient information confidential
* Performs general office duties (e.g., answering telephones, taking dictation, and completing insurance forms)
* Schedules follow up appointment if indicated by provider
* Completes required administrative tasks, reporting and recordkeeping entries at end of each day
* Returns patient calls by the end of the day
* Other duties as assigned

Requirements:
* High school diploma or equivalent; some college preferred
* Medical assistant certification (CMA / RMA)
* 1+ year of experience working as a medical assistant (dermatology experience strongly preferred)
* Knowledge of medical terminology
* Excellent grammar, spelling, and punctuation
* Exceptional customer service skills
* Friendly and compassionate disposition with strong interpersonal communication skills
* Excellent time management skills and ability to maintain effective and organized systems to ensure timely


patient flow  

* Ability to work independently or as part of a team
* Dedication to maintaining confidentiality of all patient records

**EMA experience is a plus!**

**Benefits:**

**Medical, Dental, Vision & Life Insurance**

**PTO**

**Paid Holidays**

**401K**

title: Hybrid BCBA Opportunity with Applied ABC - Hawthorne, NJ
description:
**Per Diem Board Certified Behavior Analyst Job Description**

**Position Title:** Per Diem Board-Certified Behavior Analyst

**Setting**: Variable

**Position Type:** Per Diem

**Location:** Variable

**Pay:** Commensurate with skill level and experience.

**Case details:**

* **Age:** 8 Y/O Male
* **Location:** Hawthorne, NJ
* **Family Schedule:** Mon-Fri 8:00-5pm.
* **Hybrid!**

**JOB DESCRIPTION**

**BCBA – Board Certified Behavior Analyst**

**Job Responsibilities**

· Choose a minimum of one case and meet all approved hours of the authorization,

· Reach out to the family of every new case received into your caseload within 3 business days and interview staff and/or family members who know the individual served well before the development of the plan to get background and preliminary information.

· Assume responsibility for parent training, ABA therapist supervision, and treatment planning/BTM while training staff and family members directly allowing time for questions and discussion regarding the implementation of the treatment plan.

· Conduct initial assessments and periodic 3- or 6-month re-assessments in a timely manner submitting them by the due date that has been assigned and ensure the treatment plan addresses the function of the problem behaviors.

· Directly observe the individual served in all relevant settings. Analyze the data to determine the function of the problem behavior, and where / when / why problem behaviors occur providing descriptive monthly progress notes.

· Define all target behaviors in objective and measurable terms and add to treatment plan to measure the target behaviors.

· Integrate appropriate setting event, antecedent, teaching, and consequences strategies to reduce problem behavior and increase alternative replacement behaviors.

· If the intervention has not produced substantial progress toward the intended goal within 90 days, analyze the potential barriers to implementation and/or change the treatment plan if necessary.

· Review behavior data, meet and discuss with the appropriate staff member any discrepancies noted on the behavior data (e.g., lack of documentation, inappropriate restrictions, or lack of appropriate consequences; situations in which the current behavior program or treatment approach were not followed appropriately also, check each report to ensure that time, date, signatures, are correct).

· Record all session notes in the Provider Portal and finalize monthly notes timely and before the billing deadline.

**Minimum Training and Experience:**

Individuals who provide ABA services through behavior analytic services shall be licensed behavior analyst with a scope of practice that includes overseeing the provision of ABA services and have a certification as a BCBA through the BACB

Have a minimum of 6 months of experience in providing ABA services and a master's degree in psychology, social work, counseling, education or related field.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $85.00 - $95.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Referral program

Schedule:

* Choose your own hours

Education:

* Master's (Required)

License/Certification:

* BCBA (Required)

Work Location: On the road

title: Quality Manager
description:
Description:

North Atlantic Industries is a leading provider of embedded electronic solutions, specializing in rugged embedded computing, power supplies and motion simulation and measurement technologies. Our products and services are used by the military, aerospace, and industrial markets, helping to advance technology and protect the free world.


NAI was proud to be recognized as a Top Workplace on Long Island by Newsday! Our culture is very collaborative. We have team building events, company picnics, special event day and employee game room. Please visit our website at www.naii.com/careers to see more about what makes us a unique place to work.

**Summary:**


Responsible for assuring the quality of all company products & processes. Continually improving company quality


policies related to quality control standards, integrating the quality control procedures with engineering and


manufacturing. Administering the quality control department.


Requirements:
* Establish, maintain and monitor quality systems and to ensure that the products and services are fit for their
* purpose and meets customer expectations.
* Develop & maintain quality procedures in accordance to ISO 9001 and AS9100.
* Provide direction, coordination & scheduling of work for incoming, in process & final inspection.
* Responsible to train team members for internal quality system, ISO audits, IPC-A-610, J-STD-001 and other product specific requirements.
* Prepare quality reports for customers, vendors & management team.
* Maintain the corrective/preventative action program, including tracking status of open actions, receiving and reviewing responses, working with departments for timely completion of periodic reports.
* Represents the company in plant and at customer and vendor premises on matters regarding quality.
* Provide trend & failure analysis reporting of root cause & corrective actions associated component related defects.
* Provide a robust system for managing both NAI’s and customer corrective action efforts.
* Drive supplier quality audits and scorecards for all critical NAI Suppliers.
* Interface with outside agencies as required.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree, BSEE, BSME or BSIE or equivalent experience and knowledge of ISO, AS9100, IPC & J-STD specifications.
* Familiar with FAA & MIL-STD’s a plus.
* Electronic manufacturing experience of at least 10 years with 5+ years’ experience in Quality Management.

**Language Skills**

* Must possess excellent communications skills with ability to exchange information with others clearly at all levels of the organization.

**Other Skills and Abilities**

* Must be a team player with excellent supervisory/organizational skills as well as good working knowledge of Microsoft office applications.

**North Atlantic Industries offer comprehensive and competitive packages including:**

* Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
* Company-provided Life and AD&D Insurance
* Voluntary Supplemental Life Insurance
* Long-term Disability Insurance
* Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* Tax-deferred 401K with company matching contributions
* Vacation, holidays, sick
* Employee tuition reimbursement
* Business casual dress environment
* **Schedule: M-F Day Shift**


North Atlantic Industries (NAI) is proud to be an Affirmative Action / Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all persons in all facets of employment. We encourage females, minorities, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities to apply for any open position for which they feel they are qualified. We also maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing. As a federal government contractor, in accordance with applicable laws, regulations, and Executive Orders, NAI is required to develop annual Affirmative Action Plans (AAPs). Any employees or applicants who wish to review the Affirmative Action Plan (AAP) for Protected Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities can contact us by sending an email to hr@naii.com or by calling Human Resources at 631-567-1100. If you are a disabled individual or a disabled veteran and require a reasonable accommodation in applying for any posted position, please contact Human Resources at the number referenced above. EEO is the Law, applicants and employees of NAI are protected under Federal law from discrimination. Click here to learn more about your rights.

title: Maintenance Tech
description:
Description:

As a **Maintenance Technician,** you are responsible for the inspection, repairs, and maintenance of a variety of hotel systems and equipment. Our Maintenance Technicians are thorough professionals with a practical mind and attention to detail. The ideal candidate will be able to work on a team or alone and observe all health and safety guidelines. The goal is to maintain the buildings and common areas in the best possible condition.

***This position may require flexible scheduling availability.***


Requirements:
**Job Requirements:**

* Recognize, report, and correct potential safety hazards (broken doors or railings, fire hazards, etc.) and notify supervisors of any damages, deficits, and disturbances
* Complete basic plumbing, electrical, HVAC, carpet and tile floor maintenance and repairs
* Complete painting, minor roof repairs, and other exterior projects
* Complete pool and exercise room equipment repairs if necessary
* Ongoing involvement in preventative maintenance programs
* Check stocking levels of all consumables and replace when appropriate
* Work with Chief Engineer and Management team to identify and accomplish all technical and skilled related projects
* Prepares all necessary reports during each shift for the management team
* When required, report to Hotel in bad weather conditions for maintenance of Hotel's exterior (snow shoveling, ice melting, etc.)
* Valid Drivers License required

**Job Qualifications:**

* Highly motivated team player with strong initiative and desire for achievement
* Must be effective in handling problems in the workplace including anticipating, preventing, identifying, and solving problems as necessary
* Ability to work well in stressful situations
* Ability to complete work orders on a timely basis
* Readily available and approachable for all guests while providing excellent guest service
* Ability and willingness to respond to emergency situations on short notice
* Responsible for knowing Hotel emergency procedures

**The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, sit or walk for an extended period of time. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. The number of hours you will be scheduled to work during the week is variable and is based on guest occupancy, season, staffing and other factors. Island Hospitality is unable to guarantee a specific number of work hours per week.**

**Training:**


Island Hospitality is committed to employee development and displays that commitment with a formalized training and development program providing a clear path for any employee with a desire and aptitude to thrive in the hospitality business. As team members join Island Hospitality from other organizations they too can build on that prior experience and find further growth opportunities within our company by utilizing the tools and resources offered.

**Team Member Wellness Program:** *How We Thank You For All You Bring To The Team*

**Rewarding Benefits Package:**

* Healthcare including Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
* HSA & FSA plans available!
* Dependent care FSA
* Identity Theft Protection Insurance
* Commuter benefits including transit & parking
* Pet Insurance
* PTO and Payroll Incentives for Annual Wellness Exams
* Employee Assistance Program
* Wellness Subscriptions including access to gyms, financial planning, counseling, and legal services
* Paid Sick and Vacation Time
* Family Leave
* 401(k) Retirement plan - IHM Matches 100% up to 3% of your salary and an extra 50% on the next 2% of your salary. 401(k) is fully vested upon the first contribution

**Rewarding Hard Work:**

* Incentive based bonus program
* Free room nights at our hotels and employee discounts within your hotel brand
* Discounts for friends and family within your hotel brand Team Member of the Month, Quarter, and Year recognition and bonus
* Discounted tickets to theme parks, musicals, movies, and more through Tickets at Work Career Growth through our in-house training program with a path personalized to your desired goals
* Referral bonus program to ANY of our locations

**Equal Opportunity Employer**

*Island Hospitality uses E-Verify to confirm work authorization in all municipalities where it is required by law.*

title: Consultant - Quantitative Solutions
description:
Requisition Number**2233145****Description & Requirements**
  

  

**Ready to Accelerate Your Career? Join our rapidly expanding advisory team!**
  

  

Our Enterprise Risk and Quantitative Consulting practice brings our global footprint, clients, industry expertise, and innovative solutions together to help global companies exceed their strategic objectives. Our portfolio of fortune 1000 services clients spans industries including banking and finance, insurance, healthcare, and manufacturing. Our clients range from the largest, premier global banks, insurers, and financial institutions to middle market institutions.
  

  

**Who Makes A Highly Successful Advisor?**
  

  

We are looking for team members to join our global, inclusive community of passionate risk advisors. These diverse professionals should be highly skilled, entrepreneurial, and future focused - they are self-starters with curiosity and a passion for continuous learning. They possess a strong growth mindset that propels themselves and others forward, driving innovation through delivery, and helping clients succeed beyond their expectations.
  

  

**Your New Career Challenge**
  

  

Daily, you will have the opportunity to learn and work alongside a broad mix of highly talented subject matter leaders and team members both at Forvis Mazars and at our clients. You will have an environment to explore and experience emerging, and relevant topics based on your interests and alignment to your short and long-term career goals.
  

  

As part of our growing Quantitative Solutions team, you will work with our clients, including some of the most iconic financial services companies globally, as they reshape Enterprise Risk and Quantitative services for the future.
  

  

We are seeking a Quantitative Solutions Consultant, who will perform model risk management projects, such as independent model validations, model audits, model reviews, model development projects, and various other model risk management consulting projects.
  

  

**How you will contribute:**
  

* Performing model validations by assessing the conceptual soundness and applicability of the mathematical/statistical theories, evaluating data inputs and assumptions, and testing model computational accuracy and performing outcomes analysis (such as back-testing and benchmarking)
* Performing model audits and model reviews, to assist the 3rd and 2nd line of defense, respectively
* Analytical models requiring effective challenge through validation, audit, or review may include BSA/AML, CECL, ALM, stress testing, scorecard, compliance/regulatory, pricing/valuation, regression, and economic capital models.

  

**We are looking for people who have Forward Vision and:**
  

* Ability to prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously
* Strong analytical and organizational skills with particular attention to detail
* Highly effective verbal and written communication skills
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite applications
* Ability to work both independently and in a team setting

  

**Minimum Qualifications:**
  

* Bachelor's degree in finance, economics, accounting, statistics, or other quantitative fields
* Ability to read programming in languages such as R, or Python and database management such as SQL


  

**Preferred Qualifications:**
  

* Experience with data analysis, quantitative analysis, and data validation
