title: Quant Analytics Director
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION** **Job Summary-**  

As an Offers and Shopping Data & Analytics Director within the Consumer and Community Banking Data & Analytics organization, you will support advanced analytics projects across products, sales, operations and tech teams. You will lead the delivery of a wide range of advanced analytics including sales forecasting, budget management forecasting, pre/post campaign performance insights, exploratory analysis to identify sales and revenue opportunities, generating feature performance metrics and dashboards, and crafting data stories and presentations of key findings to stakeholders. You will have the opportunity to work collaboratively with partners such as Sales, Operations, Products, Technology, Personalization & Insights, Machine Learning and Intelligence, Finance and other analytics teams across Connected Commerce.  



**Job Responsibilities-**

* Work closely with Sales, Operations, and Product teams to understand business needs and develop effective analytics solutions.
* Lead the sales forecasting process, predicting campaign performance and budgets to enable effective communication between the sales team and merchants.
* Lead analytics efforts for budget managements including identification/development of the budget management tool to ensure accurate budget delivery with minimal manual adjustments
* Lead analytics to provide comprehensive pre- and post-campaign insights, including pre-sale insights, campaign lift reports, performance analysis.
* Collaborate across functions and Lines of Business to drive Analytics and Insights.
* Prepare and deliver presentations summarizing key insights and conclusions, often for executives, in regularly scheduled analytics meeting.
* Partner closely and collaborate with data owners, product teams, and other analytics resources across multiple functional teams.

Embrace a growth and learning mindset; curious and creative; collaborative, team-oriented and client-focused; motivated by business and technical challenge.  
* 

**Required qualification, capabilities and skills-**

* A Bachelor's degree in a quantitative or related field is required, along with 10+ years of relevant experience. Experience in ad tech analytics is a plus.
* Demonstrate people management and team-building skills.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
* Experience with data mining, statistical modeling, machine learning and other advanced analytics methods.
* Structured thinker, effective communicator with excellent written communication skills; Ability to present fact-based recommendations in a clear, logical, and concise way; “tell a story” with data to all levels of management and partners.
* Must be proactive, results driven and have a proven track record of execution.
* Exercise sound judgment; act with integrity; protect our company, clients and customers.
* Entrepreneurial drive, ability to analyze problems, design solutions, and communicate effectively and confidently with relevant stakeholders to influence and gain buy-in across various job functions.

Comfortable making decisions under uncertainty and ambiguity, and proven ability to structure problems and develop analytical frameworks while addressing business and technical risks.  
*

title: Securitized Products – ABS Principal Finance and Whole Loans – Associate
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  

ABS Originations is often characterized as a hybrid between that of Corporate Finance and Markets/Sales & Trading. The work is fast-paced, demanding and stimulating— with a constant learning curve. The team is comprised of intellectually curious and collaborative team members who constantly strive to learn and grow; analyzing, synthesizing and modeling opportunities to deliver innovative client solutions.


As part of this organization, you will need to come with excellent quantitative, analytical and communication skills, and the ability to work well under pressure in a team environment. You will assume a high level of responsibility, requiring adaptability, independent project-management, and comfort working with internal and external constituents. There will be ample developmental opportunities through training/mentoring and hands-on assignments. You will have exposure to senior management on an ongoing basis; as well as direct interaction with clients, J.P. Morgan client coverage teams, credit colleagues, rating agencies, legal counsel, investors and others.

**Job Summary:**


As an Associate within the team you will work across a wide variety of asset classes and jurisdictions to originate, structure, price and execute ABS financings and whole loan acquisitions / securitizations

* Work on complex financing transactions and competitive portfolio purchase opportunities – full transaction involvement including bidding / pitching, due diligence, deal execution, and ongoing portfolio management
* Assist the team in portfolio surveillance, risk and position management (marking, hedging, P&L)
* Prepare presentations, term sheets and marketing materials, participating in new business pitches and client management
* Analyze new opportunities: value assets by analyzing data tapes and loan performance history to identify trends and model portfolio cash flows and the develop ABS structures and cash flow models
* Coordinate and communicate with internal stakeholders (Investment Committee, Sales / Syndicate, Credit Risk, Market Risk, Operations, Compliance, Technology, Accounting, Legal, etc.) and external counterparties (Clients, Investors, Lawyers, Rating Agencies, Servicers/Trustees/vendors, etc.)
* Develop and maintain expertise across different asset classes, transaction structures and jurisdictions; including conducting industry and product research to proactively identify emerging opportunities and work with the team to develop new investment strategies
* Improve processes and create efficiency and provide execution support on transactions. Review transaction and legal documents.
* US loan purchases: portfolios and forward-flows in either whole loan or structured format (Student Loans, Auto, Unsecured Consumer, SME loans/MCA, etc.)
* Private ABS financings to clients across LATAM and Canada (Mortgages, Payroll finance, Unsecured Consumer, Credit Card, Auto, SME/Merchant Cash Advance)
* Private real-estate financing across US Single-Family and iBuyer strategies, and public term issuance for SFR

**Required qualifications, capabilities and skills:**

* 3+ years of securitization-related experience
* A high level of motivation, commercial mindset and strong intuition – ability to drive projects and initiatives
* Ability to analyze and interpret data to detect trends and themes in quantitative analyses, understanding how asset performance and market metrics impact deal execution / whole loan valuations
* Ability to model ABS structures and understanding of how value can be driven via the liabilities structure
* Proficiency with Rating Agency methodologies for structured finance as well as experience with Intex
* Possess a positive attitude and determination to complete tasks while demonstrating intellectual curiosity to understand the product and business
* Strong sense of urgency and understanding of how individual work performance (including speed, attention to detail, quality) impacts the firm's ability to serve clients
* Capability to understand and tailor workable solutions for various accounting, corporate finance, bank capital, tax, legal and other market considerations
* US loan purchases: portfolios and forward-flows in either whole loan or structured format (Student Loans, Auto, Unsecured Consumer, SME loans/MCA, etc.)
* Private ABS financings to clients across LATAM and Canada (Mortgages, Payroll finance, Unsecured Consumer, Credit Card, Auto, SME/Merchant Cash Advance)
* Private real-estate financing across US Single-Family and iBuyer strategies, and public term issuance for SFR

**Preferred qualifications, capabilities and skills:**

* Expertise with VBA, Python or similar programming language highly desirable
* Excellent writing, research, and verbal communication / presentation skills
* Highly organized, detail oriented and proactive with the ability to multitask / prioritize with strong attention to details
* Strong teamwork skills and ability to work with stakeholders in multi-cultural environments
* Ability to summarize and communicate complex analyses effectively




**ABOUT US**  


JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.

title: Tax Audit Controversy Vice President
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  

The State and Local Tax team within JPMorgan Chase’s Corporate Tax Department is looking for a Vice President level candidate to support the state and local tax team that is responsible for handling all state and local corporate income tax audits.


**Job Responsibilities:**


* Handle state and local corporate income tax audits with various state tax auditors.
* Respond to information data requests and prepare supporting documentation.
* Interact with state tax auditors and participate in field appointments.
* Defend state tax return filing positions and modeling return scenarios.
* Resolve state tax controversies through settlement negotiations and closing agreements.
* Work with other Corporate Tax group members to resolve audit issues.
* Support state and local tax group on audits, regulatory, legislative and compliance initiatives.
* Communicate audit matters to State Compliance group for filing methodologies/revisions and Tax Accounting group for FIN 48 purposes.
* Participate in weekly group meetings to discuss new developments and share ideas with other team members.
* Assist with special/ad hoc projects as needed.

**Required qualifications, capabilities and skills**

* 5+ years state and local tax experience working in Big 4 accounting firm or private industry.
* Substantial experience with state compliance, state apportionment factors and scenario analysis.
* Past experience working with state government tax field auditors.
* Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excels and using programs such as OneSource tax applications.
* Developed time and people management skills.
* Excellent communication, organization and attention to detail skills that can work independently and as part of a team.

**Preferred qualifications, capabilities and skills**

* MBA with emphasis in tax, an MST and/or a CPA license.
* Financial services industry experience.
* Knowledge of OneSource Income Tax system.
* Experience using software such as SAP, Alteryx, BI tools or other data mining tools.

title: Part Time Associate Banker (30 Hours) Paterson Branch - Paterson NJ
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  


We have an obsession for taking care of our customers and employees and making them feel welcomed and valued through building lasting relationships, doing the right thing, exceeding expectations, and having a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Using the latest banking solutions combined with cutting-edge financial technology and the most welcoming and friendly service, you will be front and center representing our brand and culture. You will build long-lasting relationships with clients by sharing product knowledge and solutions as well as introducing them to our licensed bankers.

title: Administrative Assistant - HR & Finance
description:
Paul Smith is one of Britain’s leading independent design companies. We champion positivity, curiosity and creativity. These qualities underpin every Paul Smith design, whether it’s a shirt, a shop or a special collaboration. Reaffirming the values that Paul set down in 1970, ‘classic with a twist’ remains the guiding principle of the company. Happily positioned between high fashion and formalwear, while taking reference from both, Paul Smith has always been proud to stand apart.


Paul Smith is seeking a highly organized and proactive Administrative Assistant to join our team. This multifaceted role will support various departments in successfully maintaining day to day operations. The Administrative Assistant position encompasses a broad spectrum of administrative responsibilities, including HRIS maintenance, expense reimbursements, onboarding/offboarding processing, office management and support. This position is pivotal in ensuring operational excellence and compliance.


The role is based in our headquarters in New York City in a hybrid-capacity.

**Specific Responsibilities**

**HR Administration**

* Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee records, ensuring compliance
* Assist in the preparation and processing of HR-related documentation
* Support the HR team in conducting audits and reviews to maintain data accuracy
* Assist with the execution of department events i.e. teambuilding, lunches, volunteering, etc.
* Assist in fostering a positive and inclusive work culture.
* Provide a bridge for smooth communication between the HR team and internal departments, demonstrating leadership to maintain confidentiality, trust, and support.
* Participate in special HR projects as needed, such as process improvements, policy development, or HR-related initiatives.
* Monitor and update trackers for new hires, transfers/promotions, terminations, open jobs, and temps/freelancers.
* Assist in managing onboarding and offboarding process and communications.

**Finance Administration**

* Assist finance team with data input, bookkeeping, and back-up support requirements.
* Input and maintain vendor invoices, scanning invoices into system.
* Work collaboratively with various departments to perform accounting audits and ad hoc reporting.
* Work collaboratively with various departments to resolve discrepancies.
* Expense management support for SVP.

**Office Administration**

* Manage office, kitchen, and showroom supply orders.
* Mailroom duties, manage UPS and FedEx pickups and deliveries.
* Maintaining guest log for lobby security.
* Assist office leaders with occasional office projects including but not limited to showroom maintenance, greeting guests, and ad hoc filing.

**Your Skills and Experience**

* Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field is a plus
* 1+ years of HR, office management or relevant work experience
* Proficient in MS office
* Strong judgment, professionalism with ability to maintain the highest level of confidentiality
* Collaborative, team player with great initiative
* Ability to handle multiple priorities at once; fast learner who can navigate process
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
* Curious, resourceful and with an entrepreneurial spirit

**Who you are**

* High level interest in the Paul Smith brand.
* Ability to be an ambassador for Paul Smith.
* Has ability to motivate team; self-motivated & enthusiastic.
* Self-starter with good planning & organizational skills.
* Able to work flexible hours to meet business demands if required.

**What’s in it for you**

* $23 - $25 hourly
* A generous Clothing Allowance.
* Discretionary discount on Paul Smith goods.
* Basic medical and dental insurance, disability, life insurance at no cost to you.
* 401k with a 3% match.
* Vacation, sick/personal days in accordance with Company Policy.


At Paul Smith, we celebrate and encourage applications from all walks of life into our growing workforce. We are committed to empowering people from any background, belief system, or ethnicity, offering an inclusive environment where talent is recognized and valued.


This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. If E-Verify cannot confirm that you are authorized to work, this employer is required to give you written instructions and an opportunity to contact Department of Homeland Security (DHS) or Social Security Administration (SSA) so you can begin to resolve the issue before the employer can take any action against you, including terminating your employment. Employers can only use E-Verify once you have accepted a job offer and completed the Form I-9.

title: Managing Editor, Amazon Rufus, Operations Team
description:
* Bachelor’s Degree in English, Journalism, Communications, or comparable fields
* 5+ years of copywriting, UX writing, and/or editing experience
* Experience managing teams


Amazon is seeking a Managing Editor who is passionate about technology, innovation, and the customer experience. This is an opportunity to join the high-performing team behind Amazon’s new generative AI-powered shopping assistant, Rufus. Rufus makes it easy for customers to find and discover products to meet their unique needs by helping with product research, providing comparisons and recommendations, answering specific product questions, and more.
  
  

The Managing Editor will be responsible for a team of writers and annotators using prompt generation and Instructional Fine Tuning to improve the fluency of our AI models. They will uphold and contribute to quality, style, and tone guidelines, while using customer feedback to continually improve Amazon’s ability to be helpful to customers. Cross-functional partnership will be key, as this team works across Product, Science, and Design teams to evaluate CX metrics, develop scalable reporting systems, and ensure continual model improvements.
  
  

This role requires exceptional written and oral communication skills, excellent judgment, strong interpersonal skills, deep curiosity about how things work, and a passion for serving customers. You must enjoy context-switching and partnering at all levels of the organization to deliver results. This is an opportunity to gain valuable experience in the growing field of artificial intelligence and its application in diverse business settings.
  
  

About the team
  
The Search & Conversational Shopping team is creating innovative and helpful experiences for Amazon's customers. Using AI, we're creating the next evolution in shopping.
  
  

* Experience working cross-functionally to drive product improvements
* Working knowledge of the Chicago Manual of Style
* Experience writing and editing for a consumer audience


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. title: Part-Time Registered Nurse Bohemia, NY
description:
The RN will work shifts and provide the highest quality of care to clients utilizing the Plan of Care provided to ensure clients needs are met in relation to safety, well-being and satisfaction. **Bilingual Spanish speaking is a HUGE plus** but not needed.

**JOB RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Provides safe and effective personal care for the client based on individualized Plan of Care prepared by nurse and available in the clients home.
* Drives/escorts client to and from appointments/activities as requested, resulting in a safe and timely transport
* Provides prompt communication of changes in client medical status/emergencies to Nurse Supervisor resulting in effective management of cases.
* Provides safe and effective nursing and personal care for the client, based on the nursing scope of practice and individualized Plan of Care in conjunction with Nurse Supervisor/Manager of Clinical Practice. May include, but not limited to, medication administration, transferring & positioning client, catheter care, effective communication with the client, family, and Nursing Supervisor.

* Occasionally completes client assessments and supervisory visits.
* Demonstrate empathy, caring and self-confidence; ability to pay attention to details resulting in thorough follow through; anticipate problems in advance and know whether to diffuse or escalate; prioritize and demonstrate a sense of urgency.

**REQUIRED EXPERIENCE & EDUCATION**

* ***Current RN license***
* Excellent communication skills; team player; interpersonal skills; good collaboration skills; customer service skills; ability to use the electronic health record for documentation and communication regarding client care.

If you're a Registered Nurse and want to be part of a growing company with an extremely bright future and have a commitment to providing the highest quality of care to patients and their families/caregivers, we'd love the opportunity to hear from you!

**AccordCare and our family of brands** is a premier in-home personal care company providing services to people of all ages and levels of need. A better quality of care comes from exceptional caregivers and AccordCare only hires the best! AccordCare is an employee-friendly company. We focus on our employees to ensure they have a healthy work and life balance. Our employees become our family, and through excellent training and support, they are ready to serve our clients with a fresh perspective on successful aging.

title: Builder's Studio Program Manager, Global Executive Marketing
description:
* 5+ years of program or project management experience
* Experience using data and metrics to determine and drive improvements
* Experience working cross functionally with tech and non-tech teams
* Experience in stakeholder management, dealing with multiple stakeholders at varied levels of the organization


The Amazon Web Services (AWS) Executive Programs team is seeking a Program Manager to manage and plan high value executive experiences and demos in the AWS Builders Studio located in New York. The Builders Studio is a dedicated customer facing space that uses demos and customer stories to showcase innovation at AWS.
  
As a Builder's Studio Program Manager, you are responsible for the overall success of onsite customer visits to the center. This includes managing planning timelines, stakeholder expectations & communications, executive engagement, and the successful execution of briefings.
  
In this role you will work with internal sales stakeholders to provide strategic consultation on the design of on site customer engagements as well as with technical teams to strategically select the demos that are featured in the Builders Studio. You will work backwards from the customer's business objectives to develop bespoke agendas and experiences that solve specific customer challenges and drive adoption of AWS services.
  
In this role you will also significantly contribute to a global strategy for all AWS customer facing spaces.
  
You will work closely with supporting team members to develop, plan, and execute unique and impactful engagements for our customers which deepen relationships, accelerate cloud adoption, and inspire customers through the art of the possible.
  
The ideal candidate is a self-starter with the ability to build partnerships. They will have excellent project management and analytical skills and be able to manage multiple projects simultaneously. The candidate must be able to communicate effectively with executive stakeholders and deliver independently on both strategic and tactical program initiatives. The candidate should be organized, comfortable establishing processes and guidelines, collaborative, and able to work backwards from the customer to make complex data-driven decisions.
  
The position is in New York, NY.
  
  

Key job responsibilities
  
* Manage end-to-end builder studio planning process for engagements hosted in the NYC, NY Executive Briefing Center
* Develop agendas and facilitate experiences that connect AWS executive leaders, technical subject matter expert, and customers for strategic, 1:1 outcome-based discussions
* Create mechanisms and drive efficiencies to deliver engagements at scale
* Build key relationships to drive the successful delivery of a streamlined experience to internal stakeholders and customers
* Partner with key stakeholders including EBC programming, sales, marketing, and technical communities to develop enablement materials for AWS sales teams to promote program value and adoption within assigned industries.
* Improve, and in some cases, develop standard operating procedures
* Utilize exceptional communication skills to set appropriate expectations with internal and external stakeholders throughout the briefing planning process
* Identity opportunity to continually raise the bar for stakeholders by driving YoY process improvements
* Travel: < 20% time


About the team
  
AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
  
  

Diverse Experiences
  
Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
  
  

Why AWS
  
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
  
  

Work/Life Balance
  
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
  
  

Inclusive Team Culture
  
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
  
  

Mentorship and Career Growth
  
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
  
  

* 3+ years of driving end to end delivery, and communicating results to senior leadership experience
* 3+ years of driving process improvements experience
* Familiarity with sales methodologies and value based selling
* Understanding of cloud computing concepts and/or AWS technology solutions
* Relentlessly focuses on execution and consistently delivers bar-raising results
* Thrives in an ambiguous environment and can independently remove blockers and make decisions quickly and autonomously
* Ability to perform well in a highly dynamics, diverse, and rapidly changing environment

For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

title: Business Marketing Analyst, ISV, Startup, and Digital Scale - AWS Marketing
description:
* 3+ years of experience in business analytics working on large databases and external data sources
* Fluency in excel and SQL, and at least one of (by decreasing priority) Python, R or SAS
* Experience in developing, implementing, managing and executing through influence across a cross-functional set of senior stakeholders


Amazon Web Services (AWS), a subsidiary of Amazon.com and a global leader in Cloud Computing, is looking for a highly analytical and detail-oriented individual with experience in building and implementing lead management processes to support growth marketing programs and activities.
  
  

As a Growth Marketing Analyst, you'll be part of a dynamic team responsible for analyzing customer data, identifying growth opportunities, and developing insights-driven marketing strategies to accelerate the adoption of AWS services among ISVs, startups, and SMBs. Your role will be pivotal in shaping the success of our customers and driving business growth. Oftentimes, the ideal set of data may not be available, and you'll need to think creatively about what is accessible and what you can do to drive results. You will leverage your skillset in business, marketing, finance, simulation, and business intelligence to explain, quantify, predict, and prescribe solutions. You will know how to translate business and financial goals into agile, insightful analytics. Additionally, you will seek to create value for both stakeholders and customers, conveying findings in a clear, actionable manner to managers and senior leaders.
  
  

Key job responsibilities
  
* Collect, analyze, and interpret customer data to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that inform marketing strategies and tactical execution.
* Identify and prioritize growth opportunities by conducting market research, competitive analysis, and customer segmentation studies.
* Continuously explore new data sources, analytical techniques, and tools to enhance the team's analytical capabilities.
* Recognize and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation.
* Establish end-to-end reporting across multiple data sets.
* Develop and maintain comprehensive reporting and dashboards to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and measure the effectiveness of marketing initiatives.
* Continually improve ongoing reporting and analysis processes, automating or simplifying self-service support for secondary datasets, updating existing metrics as well as creating new metrics.
* Provide strategic recommendations and actionable insights to the team based on your analysis and findings.


A day in the life
  
As a Growth Marketing Analyst at AWS, no two days are the same - you'll manipulate data, build dashboards, write SQL code, share strategic insights, collaborate with cross-functional teams, solve problems, and drive the team's success through data-driven decision-making and innovative solutions.. You thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment where data-driven decision-making is at the core of everything you do. Your ability to navigate ambiguity, think creatively, and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams enables you to drive growth and success for AWS's ISV, startup, and SMB customers.
  
  

About the team
  
AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.

title: Marketing Operations Manager, AWS Americas Field Marketing
description:
* 5+ years of program or project management experience
* 5+ years of defining and implementing process improvement initiatives using data and metrics experience
* Bachelor's degree
* Experience using data and metrics to determine and drive improvements
* Experience working cross functionally with tech and non-tech teams


In this role, you will serve as a strategic partner to cross-functional teams, including field marketing, sales, lead management, and global marketing operations. You will spearhead continuous process improvements, drive execution excellence, and deliver measurable results. Your responsibilities will encompass program management oversight for lead handoff to the sales demand generation team for AWS across North America.
  
  

As a data-driven professional, you will have the opportunity to influence programs and shape the data analysis approach, ensuring that the team makes informed strategic decisions. You will play a pivotal role in enhancing the performance of the AWS Americas organization by developing and implementing policies, programs, training, and processes that increase team productivity, maximize return on investment, and elevate execution quality.
  
  

This position requires an analytical mindset, coupled with the ability to collaborate effectively across teams and stakeholders. You will have the chance to make a tangible impact by streamlining operations, optimizing processes, and driving continuous improvement within the dynamic AWS ecosystem.
  
  

Key job responsibilities
  
* Streamline lead handoff processes and oversee follow-up activities for major and globally-aligned prospecting programs
* Ensure seamless coordination and effective execution of lead nurturing campaigns across multiple channels and teams
* Develop and implement comprehensive Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to measure success and drive continuous improvement
* Facilitate weekly Sprint meetings to monitor project progress, ensure adherence to timelines, and drive goal achievement
* Proactively identify and escalate issues to leadership, providing regular progress updates and actionable recommendations
* Develop intuitive reports and dashboards within Salesforce and Amazon QuickSight for enhanced visibility, comprehensive campaign effectiveness measurement, and real-time goal tracking
* Leverage statistical analysis models to predict trends, identify potential issues, and forecast future goal achievement
* Provide comprehensive onboarding and training to new employees on the lead flow process, ensuring effective utilization of marketing tools, reporting sources, and operational processes related to lead management and nurturing.
* Drive team-wide adoption of best practices, fostering a culture of continuous learning and process improvement


A day in the life
  
Your day-to-day activities will revolve around collaborating with internal stakeholders from field marketing, sales, lead management, and global marketing operations teams. You'll tackle challenges such as streamlining lead handoff processes, optimizing lead nurturing campaigns, and ensuring seamless execution of prospecting and demand generation programs. Your primary focus will be on the AWS Americas and Canada teams, working to enhance their productivity, campaign effectiveness, and goal attainment through data-driven insights, process improvements, and strategic planning. Additionally, you'll oversee marketing campaigns compliance and management, performance tracking, and foster a culture of continuous learning within these teams.

title: Facilities Maintenance Technician - Entry Level
description:
**About Us:**



Fluidics Inc., is a wholly-owned subsidiary of EMCOR Group, Inc. EMCOR is the world’s leading provider of mechanical and electrical construction and facilities services, including planning, consulting, and operations and maintenance. Since Fluidics was founded in 1968, a lot has changed in the mechanical contracting industry, including our company. We have acquired the most technologically and physically advanced resources available to meet the growing needs of our customers.


**Job Title:** - Facilities Maintenance Technician Entry Level


**Job Summary:** -



Responsible for repair and maintenance of building related mechanical, electrical, plumbing, air handling units, and other building mechanical systems in a multi-building environment. Work may involve the lifting of heavy mechanical equipment and apparatus, and may be performed in areas of extreme heat or cold. Responds to service calls and takes immediate action to resolve emergency situations or system breakdowns. Performs preventive maintenance.


**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:** -


* Monitor BAS operation and daily building HVAC performance check.
* Repair all restroom fixtures clear drain obstructions
* Troubleshoot minor electrical circuits
* Perform minor electrical tasks to include bulb and ballast replacement.
* Perform minor carpentry tasks, ceiling tile replacement, repair or replace door hardware, locks, panic bars etc.
* Understand operation of sprinkler & alarm systems, place systems out of service and drain for testing purposes.
* Painting of HVAC equipment, cooling tower dunnage for corrosion protection, and various other areas in need.
* Inspect mechanical, electrical systems, complete mechanical logs, tour logs and daily work order reports.
* Requisition necessary material to complete required repairs.
* Perform snow removal duties and operate snow removal equipment.
* Perform any additional duties on an as “required” basis where such duties are within the scope of contractual obligations.


**Qualifications:** -


* Mechanical Trades or Trade School training.
* Minimum of three (3) years’ experience in maintenance, and repair of building mechanical, plumbing, electrical, and general building maintenance.
* Familiarity with operation of building auxiliary systems i.e. fire-life safety, standby emergency generators.
* Ability to write, execute written and oral instructions and perform arithmetic calculations.
* Valid driver’s license as required to drive any vehicles which may be assigned along with Driving skills with up to 1-1/2-ton truck.
* Strong knowledge of safe work practices and procedures typical for maintenance operations
* Ability to climb ladders, enter confined spaces, lift heavy objects and perform other physically demanding tasks.  

Safely and skillfully use all types of related hand and power tools


Shift: Day - Monday thru Friday

  


***Notice to prospective employees:*** *There have been fraudulent postings and emails regarding job openings. EMCOR Group and its companies* *list open positions here**. Please check our available positions to confirm that a post or email is genuine.*


*EMCOR Group and its companies do not reach out to individuals to help with marketing or other similar services. If an individual is contacted for services outside of EMCOR’s normal application process – it is probably fraudulent.*

  


**As a leading provider of mechanical and electrical construction, facilities services, and energy infrastructure, we** **offer employees a competitive salary and benefits package and we are always looking for individuals with the talent and skills required to contribute to our continued growth and success. Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled**


**Compensation Range:** ***$18.00 to $23.00***

**Other Compensation:** ***None***


**Benefits: We are** **committed to providing employees a comprehensive benefits package which includes medical, dental, and vision coverage, along with health savings and flexible spending accounts, life insurance, disability, a 401(k) Savings Plan, College Coach and employee assistance program.**

title: Machine Operator I (3rd shift)
description:
Starting Pay: $19 / hour

Shift: 3rd shift  



This is a full-time position within our manufacturing facility with opportunities for advancement!

  

**Who we are!**  

Schwan's Company, a U.S. affiliate of the global lifestyle company CJ CheilJedang Corporation, is a leading U.S. manufacturer and marketer of quality foods offered through retail-grocery and food-service channels. Its many popular brands include Red Baron®, Tony's®, Big Daddy's™, Villa Prima®, and Freschetta® pizza; Mrs. Smith's® and Edwards® desserts; Bibigo®, and Pagoda® Asian-style snacks. To learn more about Schwan's, visit www.schwanscompany.com.  

**What we want to do for you:**



We offer eligible employees competitive pay and comprehensive benefits package designed to assist employees and their families with their financial security, health, and well-being.


* Health, Life, Dental, and Vision Plans
* Earn up to 2 weeks paid time off during first year
* 401k with Company Match

  


**What we are looking for:**  

Here at Schwan's Company, we put a high priority on having safe, clean, and healthy workspaces. And we want individuals that take that seriously.


* Candidates with a high school diploma or equivalent, 0-1 years of experience preferred, must be 18 years of age
* This job is in a fast-paced environment and will require you to be physically active
* Operate machines safely with minimal supervision
* Lift up to 50 lbs. - bending, carrying, pushing, pulling and other activities as needed
* Communicate and problem solve with coworkers
* Stand and walk on concrete for long periods of time
* Work in cold and/or hot temperatures throughout the day
* Perform basic math and obtain necessary production specifications
* Pass on information to co-workers/relay information to and from all employee levels including management
* Work different ranges of hours such as overtime or weekend shifts (The hours for this position may change based on production schedule)
* Candidates receiving offers of employment will be required to complete a post-offer, pre-placement background check and drug screen


**Responsibilities:**


* Responsible for the operation of manufacturing equipment with simple functions
* Setting up and pre-running equipment to ensure proper production startup
* Controlling of line speeds, batch formula, production rates, starting and stopping equipment, and overall product elegance and safety
* Completing various quality checks
* The use of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) is required; including but not limited to bump cap, safety glasses/goggles, ear plugs, hair and beard nets, gloves and safety shoes or rubber boots
* Completing all required paperwork (for example: downtime, HACCP, etc., utilizing SAP, SOPs, Safety operation, training, as appropriate)
* Conduct yourself in a manner consistent with company mission, values, code of ethics, policies, and other standards of conduct


The employing subsidiaries of Schwan's Company are Equal Employment Opportunity Employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to disability, age, race, color, religion, gender, vet status, national origin, or other protected classes.

title: DSP (Direct Support Professional)
description:
The New York Foundling (the "Foundling") is one of the oldest, largest and most well-respected human services agencies in New York. Established as a home for abandoned children, the Foundling has been saving children, preserving families, and building communities since 1869. The Foundling's focus is on child welfare and the developmentally disabled and creating a community where each child, youth and adult enjoys the safe, stable and support relationships needed to reach his or her full physical, emotional, intellectual and spiritual potential. We have over 1300 employees located in every borough of New York City, Westchester and Rockland Counties and in Puerto Rico.

We are currently looking for **Direct Support Professionals (DSPs)**to support our Developmentally Disabled Division located throughout the 5 boroughs. We currently are recruiting for Full Time, Part Time and Per Diem shifts. We have 3 shifts throughout our residences, morning, evening and overnight. Below, you will see the most common schedules for those 3 shifts.

Mornings: 7am-3pm

Evenings: 3pm-11pm

Overnights: 11pm-7am

**Salary $17.72 - $18.52**

**Job Responsibilities:**

Staff will have daily contact with Residence Manager and individuals. Residence Manager will provide supervision and individuals will receive care and supervision. Regular contact will occur with service providers in the community, as well as, school, day program and transportation staff.

* Ensure appropriate supervision, health and safety of individuals; Implement Individual Plan of Protective Oversight.
* Advocate for individuals in the community (medical appointments, church, recreation activities etc).
* Ensure individual’s plan of care is implemented.
* Ensure that individual medication is administered as prescribed.
* Assist in daily living skills (e.g. personal hygiene, food preparation, housekeeping, laundry, shopping)
* Maintain facility in compliance with the OPWDD and COA standards.
* Facilitate individual’s learning and skill training in fire safety.
* Complete daily progress notes and other individual logs.
* Maintain updated certifications in CPR/first aid, SCIP, and AMAP.
* Provide atmosphere conducive to positive behavior.
* Observe, report regressive and unusual behavior and work cooperatively with clinical staff.
* Planning and preparing balanced meals.
* Cleaning and maintaining of the residential unit.
* Assist individuals with the purchase of groceries, clothing, hygiene supplies and other items needed.
* Transport and escort individuals on recreational activities, medical appointment, home visits, etc.
* Remain on shift until your relief has arrived**.**
* Complete job related tasks as needed.

**Requirements:**

* HS Diploma/GED.
* Valid NY, NJ, CT, or PA, State Driver’s License for 6 months required with 6 points or less. Experience working with adults that have developmental disabilities.
* AMAP, SCIP, CPR, and First Aid Certifications preferred. Save Changes
* Experience working with adults that have developmental disabilities

The Foundling offers an excellent comprehensive benefits package, including PTO, tuition reimbursement, in-service training, flexible work schedules and competitive salaries. We invite you to join our dedicated & diverse workforce by applying on our website at www.nyfoundling.org/about/jobs/.

www.NYFoundling.org

AA/EOE

Job Type: Part-time, Full-time, Per diem (on call)

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $17.72 - $18.52 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift

* Caregiving: 1 year (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* Pelham, NY: Relocate before starting work (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Operations Associate - Flex
description:
**Job ID:** 248499  

**Store Name/Number:** NY-34th Street (0310)  

**Address:** 130 West 34th Street, New York, NY 10001, United States (US)  

**Hourly/Salaried:** Hourly (Non-Exempt)  

**Full Time/Part Time:** Flex  

**Position Type:** Regular  

  

**Your role at Sephora:** As an Operations Associate, you'll thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. This role is about ensuring a smooth operation that enhances the shopping experience for every client. You'll be part of a dedicated team that values your unique skills. If you love the operational side of retail, this is the perfect role for you.  

  

**Key Responsibilities:*** **Ensuring Accurate Order Fulfillment:** Ensure orders are accurately fulfilled and excellent service is provided during pickup.
* **Maintaining Inventory:** Help maintain a well-stocked store for our clients.
* **Store Maintenance:** Contribute to a clean, smoothly operating store.
* **Supporting Sales and Promotional Events:** Participate in setup and execution of sales events and promotions.
* **Loss Prevention:** Participate in efforts to maintain a safe and secure shopping environment.

  

**Qualifications/Experience:*** Prior work experience, preferably in operations.
* Passion for client service and teamwork.
* Strong communication skills and ability to multitask.
* Resilience and adaptability to changing store priorities.
* Flexible availability to work during “peak” retail hours.
* Consistent and reliable attendance.
* Ability to lift and carry up to 50 pounds.

  

**While at Sephora, you’ll enjoy.**  

**Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging** We pledge to create a beauty community where everyone’s uniqueness is celebrated, respected, and honored.  

**Meaningful Rewards** Sephora offers comprehensive healthcare and wellbeing benefits based on eligibility; Details about our company benefits can be found at the following link: Click Here  

$19.00 - $23.28/hr. The actual hourly pay offered depends on various factors, including qualifications for the position and relevant experience; and other legitimate, non-discriminatory business factors specific to the position or location.  

Sephora now offers a Flex (on demand) position for employees who can work anywhere from 0-19 hours a week. This flexibility allows you to balance your work schedule with other commitments. This could be a steppingstone into a more permanent position if you are looking for more in the future.  

Sephora is an equal opportunity employer; and values a diverse and inclusive workplace. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, pregnancy, race, color, national origin, gender (including gender identity and gender expression), age, religion, sexual orientation, military/veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status. Sephora is committed to providing reasonable accommodation in our recruiting processes to applicants with disabilities or other medical conditions.  

Sephora will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with a criminal history, in a manner consistent with the requirements of all applicable federal, state, and local laws, including the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, and the New York City Fair Chance Act.  

* This job will be posted for a minimum of 5 business days.

title: Lecturer Fall 2024/Spring 2025
description:

Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Lecturer Fall 2024/Spring 2025
  

**Department** Engn - Academic Affairs
  

**Salary** Salary per Credit
  

**Posting Summary**
The School of Engineering at Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, is seeking multiple lecturers for the Fall 2024 and/or Spring 2025 semester to teach first year introduction to engineering course sequence 14:440:101/102. The successful candidates will cover the full range of duties associated with teaching, including, but not limited to, preparing course material; teaching during the assigned course times; supervising a group of teaching and learning assistants; holding office hours and providing appropriate out-of-class time for students; responding to student e-mails; conducting and grading assessments of students through assignments, exams, and other means, in a timely manner; and submitting final grades. Course appointments may require instruction during the day, in the evenings, online, or any combination of these.  


  

**Position Status** Part Time
  

**Posting Number** 24FA0482
  

**Posting Open Date** 05/07/2024
  

**Posting Close Date** 11/30/2024
  

Qualifications

* Ph.D. degree in Engineering, Engineering Education, or a related field is preferred.

* Candidates with a Master’s degree and proven teaching proficiency in engineering will also be considered.

  


Prior college teaching experience in the course topic area is preferred. Consideration of candidates will begin immediately and continue until the positions are filled.  


  

**Certifications/Licenses**

* In-depth knowledge of computer programming, particularly in languages relevant to engineering applications (e.g., Python, MATLAB).

Under Policy 100.3.1 Immunization Policy for Covered Individuals, if employment will commence during Flu Season, Rutgers University may require certain prospective employees to provide proof that they are vaccinated against Seasonal Influenza for the current Flu Season, unless the University has granted the individual a medical or religious exemption. Additional infection control and safety policies may apply.
